entries.title: Escape (what an original name)
entries.description:
YOU NEED THE SOUND to understand the game, turn the speakers on ;)

It's a HTML5 game. If something doesn't work, or works badly (no sound, game too fast, game too slow...), please report it (I tested only with Chrome and Firefox, without hardware acceleration)!

This is my first Ludum Dare.


== Cool quotes ==

"OMG I won, it was epic..." -- geekshadow about the ending

"Lol, that's priceless" -- PaulZ about the ending

"Hey, check my humble, totally awesome and super-funny HTML5 game!" -- Marin spamming LD's IRC channel about the ending

"I can't even get out of the first room." -- wademcgillis before the ending

links.label: HTML5 (you need the sound to understand the game)

entries.title: A Black and White Escape
entries.description:
This is my second Ludum Dare entry.

The goal is simple, pass the guards unnoticed or flee from them and solve some of my extremely easy puzzles and you should be good to go :)

There are an ingame tutorial so the controls should be quite easy to understand.

A timelapse will be uploaded to http://www.youtube.com/user/guywithacam sometime soon.

Please let me know what you think about the game :)

Next time I'll most likely write my game in C++ or Java.

entries.title: Cells
entries.description:
Use your wits and some hardware to hack your way out of the compound!
Find hacking keys and use the terminal in each section to bypass obstacles.

Instructions:
---------------------------
Left or A - Move left
Right or D - Move right
Up or W - Interact with item
Space - Jump
P - Pause
Use the mouse to hack while at a terminal

Notes:
----------------------------
**NB - I've fixed the font issues on the title and ending screens. I know it's a minor cosmetic change, but as not to bugger with the rules, please rate based on the "Web" version.

This was not nearly as complete in terms of gameplay as I would've liked. At the moment, it's more of a simple prototype for what I think is a nifty concept. More puzzles would be welcome, but I'm still extremely proud of this. 

Enjoy!

entries.title: Cosmic Heist
entries.description:
Cosmic Heist is an arcade-like game which might look like a shmup, but is really focused on flying (you have no weapons).

It was created with C++, SDL, OpenGL, Boost, GLEW, and my own personal code library.

entries.title: Dinosaur Liberation Front
entries.description:
You are a member of an elite team of ... dinosaur liberators.  Seems like an awfully specialized group, but hey, it's your passion.
Infilitrate the InGen corporate facility and help those poor baby dinosaurs escape!

Made using Flixel and Tiled, with Mochi leaderboards and BFXR sounds (mostly).

entries.title: Drown
entries.description:
Authors - Alejandro Valenzuela, Isaias Rodriguez, Ricardo Lopez Salazar

DROWN-

You are on an island which is about to get completely flooded, Your only way out?, a boat, somewhat far from you, you may think you've earned your survival, well think twice 'cuz you are not alone, there is someone else on the island and he'll do whatever it takes to stop you to get his ticket to salvation.

In this game you compete with other player for survival using plants you can take shortcuts or block the path of your rival to make it to the safety boat, while running away from the comming flood.

entries.title: Earth Escape
entries.description:
You are the only one left on earth, and there is a meteorite that is going to hit the earth in 10 minutes.. you have to ESCAPE THE EARTH!!! You can do this if you will find all the rocket parts needed to build a rocket.
Controls:
action    - space
movement  - arrows
exit game - escape -> you won't escape by just pressing this button

When you win the game you get your 'time left', post it in the comments!!
I put 3 executable there - big/medium/small for different sizes of the window
P.S when you get stacked just reenter the room..
P.SS - the game map and objects are saved in the data folder, there is no build in editor but you can edit it your self with Photoshop/GIMP + notepad ;) so it's a cool game engine for puzzle games!! maybe I should build a map editor?..

entries.title: escape
entries.description:
Can you crack the code and escape?

Controls: Mouse
Tools: Game Maker, Musagi and Bfxr
Thanks: YOU!

entries.title: Escape the Fate
entries.description:
An 8-level (+intro) puzzle/action game about a curse. The objective is to kill yourself - or rather, the body you're haunting. Experiment with things like dying from fall damage or getting squished by moving objects.

Important: install the included font before playing. The game loves it so much, it seems to crash without it. Thanks to Joeyy from #ludumdare for helping me discover this. After that, start the game from /dist/curse.exe. The necessary few attributions can be found in readme.txt. And let's not forget bfxr for the sound effects.

A & D to move, W to jump (even when falling), S to flip switches. R to retry if you get stuck.

-

I initially submitted this game with several hours to go. Due to feedback, the update submitted on the extended time added a simple level 0.

For people with small screens (such as laptop users): I've made an alternative version which runs in a 608x448 window. This in turn made some animations play back faster, so I also slowed them down to roughly the original speed. Otherwise the code is unchanged, it's merely a bugfix. Thanks to Wallacoloo for mentioning this. 

1.0d fixed a missing hard-coded event in the fifth level.

entries.title: Escape The Overgrowth
entries.description:
standard wasd, left mouse shooter
unfinished, buggy, unoptimized, but whatever, i'm going to bed

entries.title: Escape Velocity
entries.description:
Well... its in no way finished, but here's my firstest ever Ludum Dare entry.

The idea behind the game was that you had stolen an ultra-fast prototype military motorbike and then had to make a quick getaway. Unfortunately there wasn't any time to include any mini cutscenes explaining this. In fact there was not time to implement much in the way of gameplay, but oh well!

The game is based on a heavily modified version of this tutorial:

http://active.tutsplus.com/tutorials/games/create-a-racing-game-without-a-3d-engine/

I'm not sure if that's breaking the rules or not? If so, shove me in the Jam...

entries.title: EscapeBot2
entries.description:
I didn't succeed in finishing it, and therefore the UI is very limited and there are no sound, and the game overall isn't balanced, and I don't intend to fix it.
There are some systems that somehow refuse to play the game. Try again later or on another computer if that happens

entries.title: Forever Running
entries.description:
My second Ludum Dare game: Forever Running. Made with HTML5, Javascript and the Canvas element, so you probably need a browser which is up to date. Works best with Google Chrome.

Use A and D or the arrow keys to move. Press SPACE to jump. It's possible to double jump by pressing SPACE twice.

Avoid contact with enemies and run fast enough to reach the end of the level. Follow the green signs!

Due to the fact, that the canvas element is still a very young standard, there could be some browser dependend bugs. If this occurs (canvas is frozen, does not repaint, etc.) try reloading the page or use a different browser.

Have fun!

entries.title: Hello??
entries.description:
A short game inspired by the older point and click games. Help someone escape from his imprisonment. Your only help is a direct audio feed with that person. 

I intended to have a lot more content and features, but due to some bugs in my code I actually wanted to drop out half way through. Luckily I didn't! Enjoy!.

Made using Flashdevelop, Paint.net, SFXR and Flixel.

I just noticed the volume of the sound might be very low, you can adjust this by using + / -.

entries.title: Maze Escape
entries.description:
In this game you control small blue dot, which should run through the maze and escape from the lava flow. To win the game you must complete 5 random levels. Control - arrows or WASD.

2011/09/09 Suddenly my primary hosting is down, so I changed the links.

entries.title: McPixel
entries.description:
McPixel is a minimalistic point'n'click adventure.

There are 6 puzzles to solve, and you have 20 seconds to complete each. If you fail, instead of retrying, you are taken to nearest unsolved puzzle, unless it's the last one. 

Different actions trigger different gags, and one of these allows McPixel to save the day.

Made using FlashPunk (highfive Draknek & ChevyRay & Rolpege)

entries.title: Mind Enprisonment
entries.description: This fellow is Hobo, He is depressed. You must help Hobo escape from his depression, and help him kill himself

entries.title: Moustache Chick
entries.description:
Moustache chick is on her hunt of the mighty lady shaver. But somehow she got stuck in the mighty lava caverns of death.
Better help her to escape the ever filling lava floors and come out alive. 

PS: Press P for getting some health as a cheat, if the game gets too hard

entries.title: NO ESCAPE
entries.description:
NO ESCAPE is a game made by jukimv1986 with HTML5 canvas and audio.

You play a character trapped in a fuzzy maze, using green portals to move to the next level, which you may find with the help of a strange beeping sound...

The idea behind the game is that you are actually in a vegetative state, being the maze a representation of your damaged brain.

entries.title: Prison Lander
entries.description:
This is my first entry for a game programming competition! Hope you enjoy playing it as much as I enjoyed making it!

Be guided by the light as you play!

P.S.: You may need Game Maker 8.1 Pro to play with the source code.

entries.title: Reveal

E to interact
Space to jump
Escape.
A game by Adam Rademacher and Marie Lazar.

entries.title: Tiny Mansion Escape

entries.title: Under a Watchful Eye
entries.description:
A giant floating eye creature circles a remote landscape, keeping close tabs on the player and making sure they do not run away. In this game, you'll have to find some way of escaping the oppressive eye and reaching a control point at the center of the map.

In the submitted version of the game, there is only one real escape route. See the spoiler at the bottom of the game's page for a mini walkthrough.

Made with Unity 3D 3.4 Pro, Gimp 2.6, Blender 2.58, and a Kodak camera. All textures and models are original, and I've avoided using Unity assets or scripts, save those that are built into the engine.

entries.title: Ascii Maze
Astral Artifice
entries.description:
I didn't finish in time.. I'll upload my work and source mainly for learning purposes and in good sport.

The idea ... You travelled space for the past ten years in a spaceship that is now slowly falling apart. You need a new <Enter gizmo name> propulsion distributor, however your spaceship model is over two decades old and item is hardly found in stock anywhere, so it is highly expansive.
You get a message from an unknown contact:
"There is an abandoned space station facility nearby that was used as a custom weapons factory and spaceship salvaging depot by space pirates, the part you are looking for can probably be found there.

"Great! Maybe this is my lucky day." You head to the spacestation to search for the missing part.

The original idea isinspired by rouglikes, shmups and Robot wants, these are the features I wish to implement:

* procedurally generated space station (maze) levels.

* Upgradeable - ship + ship upgrade tree

* several types of enemies and traps

* Some boss fights.

* rare items/ unique upgrades

- Managed to write the code for procedural maze.

(Only the maze is ready)


You can use the map images in the source to win.

Thanks for saying hi:)

entries.title: Bob's Escape
entries.description: My submission for LudumDare 21 is ' Bob's Escape ' and it took me less than 30 hours to make all assets and code. I am quite proud of this as it is my first game and I wanted to make a strange game with a twisted ending. Well, I hope you are all happy with it and well... Here it is!

entries.title: City Runner
entries.description:
This is my first LD, and its been really fun! Met some great people and hope to be doing this again soon.

Any feedback you can give would be great! I'm sitting in IRC as Warrozo or you can twitter me, @DGoodayle!


Thank you and I hope you enjoy it!

entries.title: EscApe
entries.description:
Written in Java using Slick2D and LWJGL. Hopefully runs on Linux, Windows and Mac.

Initial project failed so I threw this together in 3 hours.

UPDATE:
I've now uploaded a post compo deluxe version with animations and slightly better graphics. Use original for rating. Total time spent on project, about 10 I think.

entries.title: Escape from Browser Stability
entries.description:
Last, Ludum Dare I used only the most basic of canvas operations and things went quite well.  This time I decided to push things a bit by utilising things as if Canvas rendering worked in all respects. 

Consequently, The game has issues on browsers.  I'd much rather hit these sort of problems on a Ludum Dare than in a project that my income depended upon.

FireFox 6 on Windows works fine if you have enough memory free.   I have had reports of FireFox 6 on Linux freezing X.  My own Linux box needs to be rebooted if I try this page in Chrome.
Under Windows, Chrome and Opera ran but rendered incorrectly.

As for the game itself,  I had a lot of fun making the time-to-beat runs.  It has quite a difficulty curve. The last level I have not successfully completed. 


You can use cursor keys or wasd.  Space to restart if you crash.

entries.title: Escape from the Wintry Fortress
entries.description:
Controls: 
Arrows to move, Z to shoot, X to reload (uses 1 clip)

You wake up in a fortress in the middle of Russia, and must escape. Using a hidden pistol which uses completely different ammunition than everyone else's (I'm mean like that :D) you must travel through the maze. It's a system that allows for and rewards stealth killing. I didn't get any of the character sprites, or most of the tilesets that I wanted, done, but that's due to real life and procrastination getting in the way. I'm actually rather happy about this game, and plan on expanding it in the future.

entries.title: Escape in 60 seconds
entries.description:
Controls: Arrows of WASD

Escape, run and escape again!! Exit from dungeon full of monsters before bomb explode.. you have only 60 seconds!! 

RUN!!

Avoid close combat with enemies, you have limited health!

entries.title: Escape or Die
entries.description: Not only is "Escape or Die" my first Ludum Dare submission, it's also the first game I've completed. And it shows!

entries.title: Flee your Fate
entries.description:
Once again, the file is huge by regular flash standards, in the vicinity of 10 megs.

For that reason I've included a zipped projector file (exe) for the Windows users. If any Linux and Mac users out there could put together projector files for their respective systems I'd be happy to provide hosting for their entries through the voting period :)

Instructions:
Mouse clicks for clicking through title screens, cutscenes and the like.

WASD/Arrows for movement. In the first two scenes, they have the same effect, in the final scene they are both used.

Enter is used in the final scene.

I've dropped several LD names in the game together with four different endings depending on performance and final outcome.

I hope you like it.

Edit: fixed a nasty bug that made it impossible to win, but possible to lose. We dislike that.

Edit2 (source only): Deleted and re-created the source repo on github with lower quality sound files and without the Audacity source files. This reduces the size by more than 75%. If anyone actually wants the source files just comment :)

entries.title: Gaol Break
entries.description:
This is my first Ludum Dare entry, made with FlashPunk and the As3sfxr library for embedding sfxr-generated sound effects.

Press M during any level to toggle the music.  It's off by default because I wasn't entirely happy with it. :)

EDIT: August 22nd
I'd like to thank everybody for their comments so far.  It's clear that nobody likes the "run really fast" solution to Level 3, so I'll make sure to replace it with something more fun post-judging. :)

entries.title: Maze Escape
entries.description: Arrow keys to move, try to get the yellow dot to the green dot without getting captured by a red dot.

entries.title: Mouse Trap

A rat that is trapped. You choose its fate!

This is a game that runs PURELY with javascript and HTML5 features. No need for flash! This game was developed on Arch Linux, without the need of proprietary software (apart from my nvidia video driver...)

Level editor included

entries.title: SurfN-2-Sur5
entries.description:
You are an FBI agent. Your plane exploded. You must Surf to Survive. Escape the rocks and rogue waves... if you can.

Tip: When starting out you're falling from the sky, wait until you hit the water to turn.

Tip: In order to have a successful landing you need to be facing in the direction you're moving.

Tip: Write down your longest time/distance and try to beat it (if you're into that).

Arrow keys Move
Space or Enter restarts

entries.title: The Blueprints
entries.description:
You must escape each blueprint by completing the mission objectives which can be found on the blueprint itself. Avoid letting the guards see you or they will give chase. If they catch you, you will die.  You can backstab guards when they are facing the SAME direction as you. Crack open safes and steal the goodies inside. Once you have completed all objectives, make your way to the extraction point where you will escape to the next blueprint.

Controls: Arrow keys

entries.title: Web of Flies
entries.description:
Stop the flies escaping your web!

Use the arrow keys to control the spider as it captures the flies that land in its web. If a fly is allowed to struggle for too long, it'll break free and you'll lose. Damaged web will slowly repair itself whenever the spider is nearby.

Recommended browser: Chrome (Firefox and Safari will also work, but may struggle a bit.)

My first Ludum Dare entry - an entire game as a single SVG image. Progress was a little slow while I figured out the quirks of the medium, but it came together in the end :)

All graphics and interface components drawn in Inkscape; animation and game logic in JavaScript. Enjoy!

entries.title: "Escape from Bubble land"
entries.description: Escape the bubbles!

entries.title: "EscapeBot"
entries.description:
Program your robot to escape the tests, drag and drop the instructions into the memory slots to give step-by-step instructions on what the robot should do. Get from start to finish while avoid being blown up by mines. There are 16 levels, see how much $$$ you can get before the end. Progressing through levels unlocks some more instructions and gives extra memory slots.

Tested and working in the latest versions of Firefox, Chrome (Although it should work on most older versions fine too). Doesn't work well at all in any version IE.

For the smoothest gameplay play it in Google Chrome.

entries.title: Abigail's Descent
entries.description:
Source version requires python + pygame.

This is a platforming game about a self-reliant princess who decides to rescue *herself* from a tower. Here's the video I watched when the "Escape" theme was announced, for inspiration:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jJ1VbUrRVZI

Controls are left, right, and up. The game auto-saves when you quit, so you should start at the next checkpoint when you restart it.

There are 3 levels in the game (the dialogue should make this clear, but sometimes it doesn't show up). Level 3 is pretty hard, though, so feel free to rate the game after finishing Level 2.

The game should be pretty playable as low as 10fps. If it drops below that for you, check out the README for tips on boosting performance, options, and cheating!

entries.title: Action Time : Escape from the dangerous explosive complex
entries.description:
Here's our first Ludum Dare entry : "Action Time".

It's a platformer/shooter focused on cool features like rewinding and replay and shooting bad guys (plus awesome stuff like WALLJUMPS, SNOWBOARD, BASE JUMP AND SHOOTING BAD GUYS !).

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

You play as "Roberto TNT", an action movie star on the set of his latest blockbuster : "Action Time".

Try to record the BEST ACTION SEQUENCE EVAR !!!1!

If you are not satisfied with your last moves you can rewind at any time by pressing the right mouse button to record it again. When the sequence is over you can sit back and enjoy watching your last play-through.

entries.title: BlackWhiteRed
entries.description:
This is my first entry for Ludum Dare and I'm fairly happy with how it turned out.

I wanted to focus on an escape attempt against impossible odds, which turned out pretty well. It's essentially a frantic game of attrition, getting quicker and quicker until The Runner ultimately dies. With any luck, you'll get more and more panicked as your Light starts to dwindle and more and more enemies start to spawn.

The controls and instructions are in-game, but let me know if anything needs explaining.

The graphical style ended up looking really cool in action, but there are a few things I would change if I did it again (most of them involving getting more sleep and ingesting less caffeine in some way).

One major note that I forgot to put into the instructions is that powerups have a chance to drop from enemies when they die. Light+ boosts The Guide's Light radius (which has a hard limit) and Move+ permanently increases The Guide's movement speed.

More than anything else in the game, I didn't like the fact that your ability to generate Light is based entirely on luck. I've toyed with the idea of being able to regenerate light by being near a lantern (and the people who playtested it mentioned it too), but I couldn't get it implemented in a way in which it doesn't break the balance of the game. 

Hints and Tips:
- Don't pick up too many Speed+ powerups! More control is often needed.
- Use the Lanterns to your advantage. Although they're not the best shield, they'll do in a pinch if you're low on Light.
- Don't kill every Flyer you see. They always release a Red Bullet when they die. Sometimes you're better off leaving them.
- When your COMBO hits 20/40/60/..., if you're not on full ammo for your right-click weapon, you'll get 1 ammo.
- Only use your right-click weapon when it's essential. It resets your COMBO and significantly hinders your score.

Let me know what you think of it and what score you get, my highest is 122460!

Tools used:
Game Maker
bfxr

entries.title: End of file
entries.description:
I set out to do a lot more with this project than I usually do. I pushed out of my comfort zones and went all out with it to try some new things, and some worked well. Others I'm not quite as happy with, but in the end I think its overall pretty good.

EOF is semi-platformer with an upgrade system, multiple attached levels, standard key puzzles (Everyone loves key puzzles!) boss stages and more. It also has two endings; try to find them both!

REQUIREMENTS:
Windows XP, Vista, or 7
XNA Framework 4.0: http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=20914
.NET Framework 4.0: http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=17851

The game will crash at launch if either is missing!

Timelapse: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BecVpDfQLog

Tools used:
C# / XNA (Via FlatRedBall)
sfxr / bfxr
Audiotool
XACT
GraphicsGale + GIMP + Corel Draw 3 (Not really)

entries.title: Escape from the Labyrinth
entries.description: Made with Unity 3d, MonoDevelop, Blender, Gimp, and Audacity. The only thing that wasn't standard assets in unity or made by me was http://unity3d.com/support/documentation/ScriptReference/CharacterController.OnControllerColliderHit.html added onto the standard FPS controller.  Also this is my first attempt at Ludum Dare, had a lot of fun and learned a lot in a short time.  Changed the download links to mediafire, because I did not realize how much traffic this would get (3GBs of bandwidth used in two days! wow! I'm surprised in a good way!), the web version is still on my site though, and all versions have not been updated in any way.

entries.title: Escape!
entries.description:
You will need .NET\XNA 4.0 to run this (download here http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=23714).
This game was made using the reach profile so should run fine on older hardware.

Also, thank you for taking the time to play my entry :)

entries.title: Escape innerspace!
entries.description:
Escape!

You've been accidentally injected into your beloved spouse.
Escape before re-expansion!

Pod will point toward the mouse cursor.
Left click to increase speed.
Right click to fire blast.

Charge your blast by converting flesh, simply drive over it.

Black areas are "open" and allow the greatest speed.

White blood cells are out to get you, you are an infection!
Too many white blood cell attacks will clog your engines,
trapping you inside your loved one.

Can you make it out before you re-expand and rip apart your loved one?

entries.title: escape.swf
entries.description:
A survival horror game involving spiders and fatalism.

Arrow keys to move
Stepping on a spider hurts you and makes the other spiders upset.
Health is indicated by background colour (lighter greys = bad)
Spider upsetness is indicated by the white noise.

Hint: it's easier to escape spiders to the west, but you don't want to be late.

entries.title: Get to the Choppah!!!
entries.description:
Game instructions are on the linked page, but just in case...

Controls : WSAD or arrow keys to move, mouse to aim, left click to fire.
Get to the helicopter landing zone (marked on the map with a smoke flare - visible on the intro flyby) to escape.
Don't get shot by the enemy soldiers.

entries.title: Haunted Escape
entries.description:
Escape from the mansion by avoiding the killer ghosts!

Arrow Keys Up, Down, Left and Right to move. Touching a ghost will kill you, if you fall into their line of sight they will chase you until you can loose them.

entries.title: Idol Run!
entries.description:
This is my first time using Flixel, having decided originally to work in CS5. A hasty rewrite on Saturday followed by another two days of development resulted in this, my second Flash game!

The jam's extra time was very much appreciated and meant my brother could create music for it. Fun!

entries.title: Left
entries.description:
by SLiV, Joszs and Ever121

Your vessel's shields are about to give way, your ammunition is depleted and you're about to throw yourself headlong into a room filled with hostile turrets and explosives.

If only you hadn't been so reckless in the past.

In Left, you control a small craft on its way to escape from a dangerous facility. You start out with fully charged shields, loads of rounds and even a couple of rockets. However, they'll have to last pretty long if you're planning to get out.

Luckily, you can revisit the past and master your challenges to perfection, granting you more room to spare in the present.

This topdown action/agility game was made in less than 72 hours. Tested to work on Windows 7 and XP.

entries.title: Planetary Mission
entries.description:
Z = jump, X = fire
I coded this on a friend's computer, so if there's a weird @author comment in a source file I've overlooked, that's why. All assets and code are my own.

entries.title: Roman Rush
entries.description:
Game can be played at http://jamieclinton.com/escape/

Code can be found at https://github.com/jcclinton/LD21-Game

entries.title: STOPCOCK
entries.description:
A ZX Spectrum RPG.

Worked for 72 hours, amongst family things, really more like two day's proper work.

This is an biographical tale of my papa's arrival in England in the 60's, based on an unpublished novel he wrote.  As he's not around to fill in the details, I had to make some of them up.

It's ... it's ... I don't really know what it is.

entries.title: The Island
entries.description:
RTS style game where you lead a group to rebuild their ship and escape the horrors of The Island.

Made with LWJGL and Java, might work on MacOS and Linux but has not been fully tested on those platforms.

entries.title: Underland
entries.description:
Phew, made it!

Use the cursor keys to move, and the return key to pick up treasure. Alternatively you can click on the on-screen buttons. Try to get to the exit without being swamped by monsters!

entries.title: A Robot Escape
entries.description:
You are a robot attempting to escape from a robot prison.  Enlist the help of deactivated robots for assistance.

Arrows or WASD to move
Enter or Space to upload your A.I. to deactivated robots
Escape to pause or get help

This was kind of an experimentation for me in using Silverlight as a game engine.  Let me know how I did.

entries.title: Abstraball
entries.description:
Help the poor yellow ball escape the prison guarded by evil mean guards!

It's a top down 2D-turned-to-pseudo-3D game in which you control a little yellow ball through a complex filled with bad guys. You can only see things that aren't blocked by other things, so you can't see past walls. A compass tells you the general direction to move to. 

There are 4 difficulty modes. The fourth mode, plague bearer, changes the game a little bit. As a plague bearer, if you touch an enemy that is not aware of you, then he will die. Make it to the end as a plague bearer and you will earn a virtual cookie for being awesome because I haven't finish it yet that way!

I've committed so many sins while writing this game. It's unbelievable. Beware of the source code.

Enjoy!

entries.title: Castle-Game Engine
entries.description: Its not a lot, I know. But its something.

entries.title: Claustrophobia
entries.description: A maze hack and slash game made by two twelve yearolds. You wake up in a huge dark dungeon, you can only see a few feet in front you but you can tell that the floor is covered with moss and that it looks like no one has been down here for a very long time. You have to find a way out of here...

entries.title: Dragon's Bloodmoney
entries.description:
Run away and save the kingdom.

This is an early release. I hope I can update it later :)

If you like you can watch the timelaps at http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m5Kf03v1Uws.

Update: I can :).  There is music in the game now.  I used the ingame sounds (like jumping, checkpoint) as samples.

On Windows you can extract it and start the batch file.  Other operating systems needs Love2D to run (http://www.love2d.org) at the moment.

entries.title: Eggscape
entries.description:
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Make A Game presents: "Eggscape"

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

"Oh, I didn't see you there, crushing my path for survival and my dreams of becoming a famous paleontologist. 

Do you know how hard it was to find this egg? And how lucky I am that these debris are falling in such a coincidental position that I can climb some of them? It's like someone is throwing them with exact precision. But I don't have time to think about it, actually I can't do much more than panic and run around, waiting for more debris to fall." 


We're Make A Game and Eggscape is our entry for Ludum Dare 21's Jam.

This wasn't just our first time competing at Ludum Dare, it was our first time working with flash!

Feel free to follow us at http://makeaga.me or @MakeAGame on Twitter for our incoming Post Mortem!

Contact us at [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */

Have fun!


---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

How To Play

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

You don't control the character,  you control the falling debris.
He can only climb the height of one block.
He also doesn't climb down.
And if he gets eaten, it's game over, man.

LEFT and RIGHT to move
UP to rotate
DOWN to place
ESC or P to pause


---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

UPDATE #2
Forgot to add a Read Me.txt file to the zip file.

UPDATE #1
Oh hey, working scores! :D

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Things to add post submission:

- Treasures!
- More modes!
- Gameplay Tweaks!
- Fix Character random suicidal behavior! (especially with line piece)
- And many more!

Please read the Read Me.txt file in the zip version for more info.

entries.title: Esca
entries.description:
This is written in C (Standard 89) and uses SDL and SDL_ttf.

I didn't quite finish as well as I wanted, but it's playable. It runs well on both Linux and Windows.

To play, type in a command followed by a space.
The commands are usually pretty basic stuff like "run" or "sprint".
(Those aren't real commands in the game, if I told you what the commands were that would spoil the fun.)
Just remember commands are separated by spaces which means when you type a space the command starts over.
This is a simple game which hones your typing skills, so any key that isn't a letter or a space will just send gobbley gook to the program.

Keep typing and you can help Esca (The purple rectangle) escape from illiteracy.

EDIT: If anyone can beat this please let me know. As for right now it's probably too hard. (I made the level in the last couple minutes before the compo ended) :D.

People who have finished the game:
-Tnelsond (ofcourse :))
-Shadow
-the31 (editted the mapfile)
-LegacyCrono
-jwfrosty

entries.title: Failed Turn-based Space Combat
entries.description:
This doesn't fit the theme, and isn't complete enough to be a game. But it's what I spent the weekend on.

I've written a bit more about what I was trying to do with it on the Google+ blog post linked to above.

entries.title: Infection Run
entries.description:
Well, here it is.
However, it isn't really completed.
I stopped working on it since I knew I couldn't complete it in time.
However, I have learned a lot and that is the real reward!

YOU NEED XNA FRAMEWORK 4.0 FOR THIS

entries.title: Jameson Livingston Penguin
entries.description:
Escape from a zoo that I ran out of time to draw, and make your way to the moon! Use the arrow keys to maneuver things in the sky while collecting health and speed boosts. Included are the XNA and .Net libraries, if you don't already have them installed.

Apologies for windows only, such is the way of XNA.

If you're curious, you can read my development logs on my website @ http://wbobeirne.github.com

entries.title: LoDerunner
entries.description:
Based off of the original LodeRunner game.  Get the key, then get to the exit door.  Full source is included in package, so if you have Linux/Mac just install Python2.7, PyGame, and SDL (that's all that's required) and you should be good to go.

If you're on windows, just extract the zip, and double click on AAA GAME.exe

Controls:
W -> Move up ladder
A -> Move left
S -> Move right
D -> Move down ladder

E -> Dig a hole in front of the player
Q -> Place a trap in front of the player (have to give it a second to set before the enemies come)

Wish I had known they were having an LD compo earlier.  Had no preparation, so I had to learn PyGame really fast, and I hadn't touched Python in a while.  Also have a 3 three year old son I had to take care of throughout.  Came out okay, though.  Sad that I had to cut the sound out at the end because of deployment issues with Py2exe :<

entries.title: Mindbane
entries.description:
Mindbane is a 2D action platform game. Manipulate physics and try to escape from the dangerous mind maze.
Developed with GameMaker Standard 8.1.

A post mortem is available here:
http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2011/08/25/mindbane-post-mortem/

entries.title: Ninja Escape
entries.description:
Game play instructions: 

WASD to move/jump. holding space while moving towards a wall grabs onto it. pressing jump while grabbed onto a wall allows you to wall jump. Left click throws a shuriken and right click throws a smoke bomb.

Tips:
Pick up a thrown shuriken from the ground to be able to throw it again immediately. Use smoke bombs to obscure the guards vision.

Note:
I ran of time and couldn't add as much as I had planned and I'm aware there are a few minor bugs still in.

entries.title: Not Without You
entries.description: "Not Without You" is a fun and challenging puzzle game in which the player must guide blue spheres to unique escape hatches.  The catch?  All blue spheres move in unison, and all escape hatches must be occupied for the level to end.  This intuitive and addictive game was developed in less than 48 hours for the Ludum Dare 21 competition.  Enjoy!

entries.title: Prison of Air
entries.description:
You are a sentient water particle, and you need to collect other water particles so you can ESCAPE from your "Prison of Air".  Use the mouse to move, touch water particles to collect.  After beating the game, you can use your browser refresh button to start again!

So, at the start of this compo, one of my good friends wanted to team up.  As I normally submit little games that I make in my own "engine" with very few tools to work with, I needed some form of middleware to handle assets.

Initially, we went with Cryengine3, but currently, you can't log in with the same developer account and all level files are encrypted to the login.

After learning that, we switched to Unity.  Neither of use had used Unity before so there was a lot of learning involved; I spent about equal time making this game as I did looking up documentation and going through tutorials.  Still, we managed to make a little game and hope to make a bigger one next time!

Code/Script/Final Deployment/Crappy Particle Shower at End by Max Maroe (Drakfyre)
Particles/Music/Sound/Game Design by Justin Moravetz
Rain sound effect found here: http://www.freesound.org/samplesViewSingle.php?id=118514
Special Thanks to MasterHyjinx for hosting TWO days of barbecue for the event!

EDIT: Added ports to Windows and Mac; I have not tested the Windows port but will later; let me know if it gives anyone any trouble.  Source is available as well; includes all assets and Unity files and stuff.

entries.title: Red Rover
entries.description:
EDIT: If you tried a Windows build and it failed, please try again. Jiggawatt has generously built (another) version that seems to work for people. (Clearly, I need to get better at using cxfreeze/py2exe.)

Red Rover is an introspective game about a robot on a scientific mission. It is a puzzle game with more than one ending.

You can choose to explore, carry out your mission, or simply contemplate the vast loneliness of being stranded on an alien planet.

*** There may be more to the planet than meets the eye! :) Please explore a little bit before deciding to analyze every rock! ***

Currently requires Python2.6+ and Pygame. I hope to have an app and an exe built if I can figure out the respective tools.

If you are having trouble grabbing rocks, it helps to imagine the grabber claw in the exact center of the rover. So try to position yourself directly over the middle of the rocks (or where you want to drop the rocks). In retrospect I should have put the claw on the front (or back) to make it visible, but there just wasn't time.

I have put some spoilers online here http://plastic-idolatry.com/ludum/redrover-spoiler.txt in case you find the puzzles hard or want to cut to the chase.

entries.title: Room Escape
entries.description:
You find your self in a strange room with strange objects.

Direction Keys to move, Z to Jump, X to attack and Down to Use items.

entries.title: Rooms
entries.description:
Java/Swing game (jar)

Press enter to start
Press the space bar to talk
Hold the arrow keys to move

entries.title: Sharks Are Evil
entries.description:
My fabulous entry and also my first into Ludum Dare. Made using FlashDevelop, FlashPunk, PunkUI and Photoshop.

Those pesky sharks are up to no good yet again! They wait with their mouths wide open in anticipation of gobbling up some unbeknownst swimmers as they hurtle towards them.

You - Yes, you! - are their life ring wielding saviour! Move across the bridge using the arrow keys and throw life rings to help the swimmers avoid the nasty sharks. Z will throw a ring which will move swimmers to the left and X will throw a ring which will move swimmers to the right.

You're their only hope!

entries.title: Spotlight Search Deluxe
entries.description:
A Scratch game written by Mini Troll (age 9 1/2) and Papa Troll (age 39 3/4). Playable on Scratch website, downloadable with full scripts.
All art and sounds created by Mini Troll
All scripts created by Mini Troll and Papa Troll

Created in one day. Blog here: http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2011/08/21/spotlight-search-deluxe/

entries.title: Stranded: Episode 1
entries.description: "Stranded" is an episodic game about a crazy scientist, his trusting (but gullible) assistant, and the small brown barn spider that binds them together.

entries.title: Twister
entries.description:
Got like a minute left so linked to the swf

**update***
just found the edit entry so yeah, the version i had by the upload time doesn't have focus on a few screens when on the web, so start game click the screen then use the arrow keys to  accelerate. Didn't get the retry function bug free in time so the game just ends instead.

entries.title: Warden's Burden
entries.description:
You are the warden of a psychiatric ward.  Your job is to take care of the best lunatics and crazies society can produce.  You must make sure they do not escape the premise.  This can prove difficult because they damage everything they get their hands on.

Arrow keys to run.  Hold Shift key to walk.
Repair walls and other constructions by walking (or running) up to them.

Source code is included.  The software is built using C++ and OpenGL 2.1.  It also uses the following libraries:
- boost
- SFML 2
- Eigen
- DevIL
- Box2D

entries.title: "It's A Bunny Story, Actually..."
entries.description:
A simple, (hopefully) charming 2D platformer, with some very 'unique' background music/sound effects. If people like it, I'll be fleshing it out into a more 'fully featured' title at some point in the future.

Everything is more-or-less self-explanatory. 

I've since begun an 8bitfunding project to try and raise some money to turn "It's A Bunny Story, Actually..." into a full commercial title. More info available here: http://8bitfunding.com/project_details.php?p_id=221

Please help my dreams come true? Love you forever?

entries.title: =-=Solar Escape=-=
entries.description:
Overview:
You've accidentally started a chain reaction that may destroy the entire universe.
You've got to go warn everyone of your mistake!
Your ship's booster's aren't enough to outrun the explosive reaction you've caused.  Use different planets' gravities to slingshot yourself faster to outrun the reaction you're responsible for.  Crashing into space debris will slow you down, and may allow the supernova to catch up with you!



Instructions:
Press Right or Left to control your ship.
Press Down to brake.
Fly into blue planets to increase your speed.
Crashing into red debris slows you down.
Increase your speed enough to move to the next level and warn your compatriots!

entries.title: Beak Free
entries.description:
Use your mouse to guide birdie out of various buildings he's got himself stuck in. Do it under par to unlock harder levels.

Note: Due to there only being 5 levels(+1 super secret bonus), I made the difficulty quite high. All the levels are possible below par, just try to not hit everything.

entries.title: Chemical A-21
entries.description:
*** Post-comp version (do not rate!) ***
 - [tab] key toggles less/more detail (may run smoother)
 - mouse cursor is now shown in windowed mode (plays nicer)
 - I have not accessed a Mac yet to compile a Mac port... (soon!)


Chemical A-21 is leaking throughout the complex and, for whatever reason, only YOU can stop it!

Use the left/right mouse buttons to place and pick up barriers to block the A-21 from spreading to the edges.

You have to be quick, but steady too, as a single gap in your walls can ruin you.
Some levels require a bit of planning/strategy...

Good luck! I'm interested to know how hard it is / how long it takes.

entries.title: cosmoZ
entries.description:
Tools used: Blitzmax/Photoshop/cfxr/Audacity.
Framework: homemade miniframework (public sources)

My first entry!
cosmoZ is a try to create a game with no tile map, no characters, and the most linked to the theme.
You have to escape from your dying planet to the promise land, using your space ship (the violet square on your screen...).
Mechanic is based on travel range (depending of the planet around which your in orbit. There is also special planets: asteroids (destroyable after take-off) and satellits (attracting your ship automatically).

I think there is something good in the gameplay. However, this is really unfinished. For example: difficulty curve is bad, and gamefield is not everytime fun to play (too much random, need some improvement).

It took me around 15 hours of work (or less) as I took some long break, and start late on the first day (and sleep a lot :)).

Enjoy!

entries.title: Damn My Stubby Little Legs
entries.description:
So this was a bit of a pain to put together. At least more than I thought it would be.

You play Stubbs, who has to escape from a tower slowly filling with water. There... really isn't any backstory to this. JUST MAKE BELIEVE. Ride the water upwards and try to avoid the platforms. If you hit one, catch up with the water or make it to an exit before Stubbs' tiny little lungs run out of air!

Arrow keys to move above, on and below water.

It was put together in AS3 using Flashpunk (if I'd had more time and not been about to fall asleep on my keyboard, I'd have included the flashpunk splash page). I used GraphicsGale for pixel art, Ableton Live 8 for music, OgmoEditor for maps.

I don't really know how fun it is to play. I'm really just glad that I managed to get it finished!

NOTE: There is a bug where once you reach the top of the level, you can't swim below the top half of the screen. Because of that you won't be able to get to a couple of the exits (the map sections switch around when the map is loaded, so you might not come across this problem). There's a bugfix version that I've linked to where this is fixed, but the competition version comes with the bug.

entries.title: Dwarflings
entries.description:
Your prisoners, the dwarves, are escaping! Move with the arrow keys. Press space to jump. Turrets cost $50 to place. Place them with the down button. They can be moved by standing in front of one, and pressing up. Press up again to drop it. After a few shots, the dwarves will fall. Pick them up by walking over them. Move them to the jail, and trap them. If you don't pick them up in time, they will get up. See how many of you 200 prisoners you can keep! 

Concept: Joecool117/Pie
Programming: Pie, Art: JoeCool117.

Our first LD!

entries.title: Enough time for escape
entries.description:
Requires Net 2.0, runs via OpenTK, so it might run on mac / linux too with Mono (untested). More info in readme.txt

Update: Since the game is now really too hard as I hadn't time to do enough recipes, I made a list on following link (for those who don't want to spend a lot time finding them out for themselves):
http://dl.dropbox.com/u/19916467/Recipes.txt

Other hints:
HOLD space to attack anything in front of you including those pesky cats (they'll try to run away after first hit).

There are several different endings, one good, few not so good and one (not so) hidden.

entries.title: Escape Artist
entries.description:
*Note: If your resolution is too small to fit the game, press S.*

Windows: Run main.exe.

You are the greatest escape artist alive! Kill people with your dead bodies, loot gold from your vicious (but stupid) captors, and teleport like crazy.

But most importantly, escape!

entries.title: Escape Imprisonment at the Satanic Mental Hospital
entries.description:
You are a prisoner, imprisoned at the Satanic Mental Hospital. You must escape imprisonment at the Satanic Mental Hospital!

You can do it!

Built in Flixel, using Flashdevelop.
Photoshop for the tiles, GraphicsGale for the sprites.
Voices recorded in Audacity (mine + wifes).
Sound effects made in Increpare's lovely BFXR.
Music made with FL Studio.

Thank you for playing!!!!!

entries.title: Escape Kraut
entries.description:
You've just completed a mission deep in the heart of Berlin.  

* Make your escape via the heavily-guarded Autobahn.

* Keep your speed up to confuse the German machine-guns.

* Watch out for the tar-traps and blockades.

Control scheme is a little involved, but it's not a racer. Try jumping!

No sound/music sorry. Ran out of time.

The source is a Unity project. Extract it to a folder and open that folder in Unity if you need to look at the source.

entries.title: Fireflies
entries.description:
Your fireflies have escaped! Bring them back!
Incomplete game, but I'm quite pleased with what's there...

entries.title: FuhFuhFire!
entries.description:
FuhFuhFire! by Robert Yang (@radiatoryang)

WASD to move, SPACEBAR to jump.
MOUSE to look, LEFT-CLICK to do stuff.

>>> You're the type of guy who starts fires, just so you can save people from them and be a hero. First you'll set your Fire Bomb, then you'll rescue your Victims. Maybe your plan will go awry (it probably will) and you'll just have to ESCAPE by yourself, leaving the rest behind in their screaming agony?

- 8 different endings
- dynamic fire propagating system
- dynamic level destruction! wow!
- totally unrealistic model of firefighting
- ... and more!

Made with Unity3D, some super simple models in Maya, some sounds recorded on a Singstar USB mic + Audacity, and some simple textures in Photoshop.

entries.title: Incomplete Escape Racer!
entries.description:
Totally incomplete (~12 hours work) but thought I'd at least submit it :)

In-browser racing game (all HTML5, JS & CSS 3D transforms).

Safari or iPad (landscape) ONLY. Chrome has rendering bug.

Controls:
 - Safari: Arrow keys
 - iPad: Onscreen controls

Have fun driving in circles :) See if you can "escape".

entries.title: Left Again
entries.description: This is my first time doing a Dare, made with Flixel. There are 15 levels total, each adding a new enemy to the mix. I hope you guys enjoy! :)

entries.title: Prelude of the Chambered
entries.description:
The web version will play immediately. If you want to play it offline, get the zip file and launch the html file locally.

You need java to play this!

entries.title: Reach For It
entries.description:
Short abstract shooter. Help the creature reach Freedom from the depths of an alien planet. Arrow keys to move, X to shoot, C to strafe (hold direction), or additionally WASD to shoot.

Tools:
Flash Develop
Graphicsgale
Photoshop

Libraries/Frameworks:
FlashPunk

Cheers :D

entries.title: Run Escape
entries.description:
Escape from the Ludum Dare monster! Run across the source code of the game. Make it to the finish and he will be too full to eat you.

Controls:
Escape to start and jump
Space to stop the character

Here is a video of the gameplay.
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hWL4XhBxYuI

entries.title: Shapechanger (incomplete)
entries.description:
I "escaped" from finishing this game - not because I didn't have time, but because it was going in a direction I didn't like. The introduction is still fully functioning and the game mechanics work properly (although they lack the later content to be able to demonstrate such).

Escape is used in both a literal sense (the very beginning) and a metaphorical sense (escape from the physical self) although I did not fully flesh out the second.

Note: source is included in downloads under the game folder

Mostly this was a learning experience for me - as my first LD, I found it very different from a miniLD. In the future, I plan on brainstorming ideas for ALL themes before the competition, doing art by hand and scanning it, and not giving the player effectively over 1 billion options per encounter (1,889,568,000 to be precise - the main reason I ended up scrapping this project)

entries.title: Virtual School 2

entries.description: This game involves a virus being uploaded to a computer and infecting it.  You must do it before the owner of the computer presses Escape and cancels the upload.  The game has a few errors in grammar on the title page, and possible other places as well. entries.description: Spent a whole bunch of time sleeping this weekend, but managed to make something that resembles a game, so here it is. You are an outlaw running from the law with some loot on horseback. Jump over chasms and fire your gun at your assailants.

entries.title: It's Right Behind You!
entries.description:
It's Right Behind You! is a race to escape the lava chasing you down into the caverns.  Can you make it to safety?  Features destructible terrain, multiple difficulty levels, and fast-paced platforming action!

This game was made in lua, using the love2d framework.

There's a demo/speedrun of me beating nightmare mode up on YouTube: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pvZEqWZdy_Y#t=5s

You must shoot your way through the caverns and collect the keys to open the final door, before the lava rises and you become toast.

entries.title: Mob Escape
entries.description:
Mob Escape was an attempt at making a reverse tower defense game where you are the guys running through towers trying not to get killed. That idea evolved and eventually I ended up with this game. Basically you have 3 guys following you and you are running though corridors and rooms trying not to get hit. While making it there were several points where I wanted to quit because it just wasn't very fun, but I'm glad that I stuck it out and finished. There were a lot of things that I planned on adding (obvious by the inventory boxes on top that are never used), but not enough time. If I ever decide to do any more work on this you can find it at http://joedev.net

Controls
WASD or Arrows = Movement
Space = Pause
Left Click = Shoot

entries.title: Pressure

I was unable to make a complete entry this time around. Being still in high-school, my parents reserve the right to change my schedule at any time. So what I have finished is merely a concept with only 4 levels. Not much, but it's playable.

Use the arrow keys and the space bar to guide your character to the exit. Run from the advancing wall of doom.

After the competition, I added a few more levels and revamped the graphics and menus. you can play the post compo version here: http://dl.dropbox.com/u/2727127/Pressure/World1.swf

entries.title: Real Live Avatars INC
entries.description:
It was nerve-wrecking, and after all that I'm not sure I delivered the ending properly. Please tell me how I did!

Also, the31 was kind enough to let me put my files on his website. Thank you very much, the31!

Due to the site being whatever it was, I couldn't log my progress :(. But I DID write a huge postmortem.

entries.title: Stupid Escape game

Sprites made by me in ms paint, game made in game maker 8.

I know I won't win , but just for competition ;)

entries.title: The ESCape
entries.description:
The theme of the game is that you are an "Idea", a white block navigating a "thought" maze. The player can use the arrow keys to navigate the maze and by pressing the Escape key, "change their mind" (aka, randomize the entire maze). The Idea is searching for various "Goals" though out the maze so that it can travel deeper and deeper. 

As the Idea travels into the thought maze, new obstacles such as grey permanent walls (was going to call them "Beliefs", a la "beliefs set in stone") and red "Doubts" (monsters) that randomly toss the Idea into another part of the maze. Once the player gets through 20 levels, they get the ending message that I was, in my own heavy handed way, trying to convey.

entries.title: The Grind

The Grind is a simple game about escaping from work at a reasonable hour by avoiding responsibility.

The goal is to acquire as little work ("to-do's") as possible throughout your 9-5 workday. Wander around the cubicles and hide from the men in suits--if they're coming your way, that means they want to give you work to do!

Use the arrow keys to move, space to start, and escape to exit.

Gameplay video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rKPY5R4reJY

The game and assets are licensed under the terms of the GNU GPL. Enjoy!

entries.title: Aphelion Incident
entries.description:
What a wild ride it's been, that's for sure. Oh, I forgot to add any kind of tutorial feature this time, and the UI is horribugly, so here's the control and premises:

CONTROLS:
Left/right keys - Move / Toggle between terminal logs and memory logs in menu
Up/down keys - Scroll through terminal logs and memory logs in menu
Z - Jump / Start game
X - Use / Fire
C - Control nearby guard
M - Open/close menu (you can also close the menu with X)

PREMISE:
You're a psychic alien locked up on a space station. You know there's a teleporter out, but you don't know where. However, you can use the terminals and hijack the minds of the guards to try and escape. Good luck. You'll need it.

ASIDE:
I am missing nicer graphics, sounds, and music, but I got a little further in terms of complexity this time around than I did with LD20's Throwbots in a totally different environment, so, success to a degree! I already gave credit to some people in the game proper, but props to all those who supported me and made this thing possible!

I learned a great deal of lessons and I should be writing up a post-mortem by next weekend. See you then!

EDIT: Fixed a showstopper bug involving the game locking up when hit by an enemy (pretty critical) and a duplicate (and a missing) terminal.

entries.title: Attack Of The Chasers
entries.description:
Welcome to Attack of the Chasers!

My hardest game yet :P 

Use the mouse to control the player and avoid the obstacles!

entries.title: Block Faker
entries.description:
The theme is here. Find it.
Greyish X-blocks don't match. This is never taught to you.

Things that ARE taught to you:

Remember that advancing screens is done by pressing SPACE.

If the game freezes and crashes don't get too upset -- you were likely already in a position to lose all progress (i.e. you would have been sent to Level 1 anyway; kill and reload the page!)
If the game freezes and crashes while normally advancing levels, I apologize profusely.

entries.title: Escape from the Dungeons of Dread
entries.description:
So I made a one button roguelike. You play as a brave warrior trapped in the dreadful dungeons of dread and have to escape. 

Made in XNA 4.0.

entries.title: Escape from the elemental maze
entries.description:
You are a ball of plasma trapped in an elemental maze. As you explore you can find different elemental modes to aid you in escaping unscathed from the numerous monsters out to get you.

Keys:
Arrow keys: movement
Esc: Exit
1 - raw mode (default mode. Gives you more health)
2 - light mode (enemies notice you more, but after 5 seconds you get path finding to nearby objects of interest)
3 - plant mode (slower movement but decreased damage from enemies and increased health regen)
4 - lightning mode (take damage over time but damage nearby enemies)
5 - water mode (enemies lose all friction and have worse control (doesn't work well, don't use))
6 - shadow mode (enemies less likely to notice you, but you take more damage)
7 - air mode (you move a lot faster, but are extremely vulnerable to damage)

Tested in both linux and windows. You need python2.6 (or greater but not 3.0), pygame and python_openGL to run.

Can download pygame installer for windows easily, but I found for pyOpenGL I had to download setuptools and run from the command line

To run the game, just run the "elemental_escape.py" file.

c:\python26\scripts\easy_install.exe PyOpenGL PyOpenGL-accelerate

Known issues: 
-Framerate is quite low (I think due to locking inefficiencies between movement and drawing threads)
-Water mode allows monster to go very fast due to poor drag model.
-Sometimes you (and monsters) can cut through the walls at their ends (not a big deal but not perfect)
- breadth first search for path-finding (light mode) is inefficient. Maximum path-size is probably a good idea so the light-mode only checks for nearby items.

ToDo:
- Text to the screen for detailing keys to use, powers from the modes, that you've won the game, or lost the game, etc.
- Better graphics (including animations), sound.
- More than one kind of enemy, more interesting escape from them.

Tips on playing the game:
- Monsters are less agile than you are. If you quickly dodge them effectively they can't find you.
- You always start in the bottom-left of the maze, and the exit is always at the top-right of the maze.

Also just a warning: I should've said this earlier so sorry to those who put the effort in and were disappointed. I did this game in very little time and I'm not really very experienced in game programming. The main problem is that I got it working and then didn't tweak it to be actually fun. So this game isn't really very good and I am aware of this. Only download if you're willing to try a not so good game and give it the rating it deserves.

entries.title: Escape from the Frame
entries.description:
Done in 48 hours.  Simple, too many mini games, so none of them are as high quality as I would like.

OS X: tested on my OS X Lion machine, I don't have a pristine machine to test on, nor an older machine, so I'm only saying it works on Lion.  It _should_ work w/out installing pygame. 

Linux: you must have python-pygame previously installed (debian/ubuntu: "apt-get install python-pygame").  you can download the source and run 'python escape_from_the_frame.py' or you can feed the url to 'pip install' and run 'escape'

entries.title: Escape...
entries.description:
made with python + pyglet.  if you're not using windows, you should be able to run the game on any system by downloading pyglet from http://www.pyglet.org

If you get errors about AVBin missing, please download appropriate file for your system from http://code.google.com/p/avbin/downloads/list

Sorry about this inconvenience.

graphics with adobe photoshop cs4
sound with sunvox, guitar pro and garageband, with adobe soundbooth for tinkering
notepad++ for code

it's a thing, maybe it's a game, maybe not.  it's probably not fun.  i wanted to try to do something a bit experimental and - dare i say - artistic with a bit of thought underneath, so take it how you will.

you need to escape!  watch out for monsters.  interact with things.  if nothing happens, try to motivate yourself some more.

dont read the source, cause that's where the real monsters lie (=terrible coding!)!

entries.title: Flow
entries.description:
wasd to move
x to open doors
z to activate bullet time wich slow down time plus it let you move alot quicker and avoid stuff easier
r to restart if the game glitches

you can 
wallrun
walljump
crouch slide
the longer you run the more your speed and jump height increases

TIP: do not do as the first arrow says when it points down, you will fall and die and if you havent made it to a checkpoint before you die your game will crash

entries.title: Fuck El Dorado! Let's get the hell outta here!!1
entries.description:
El Dorado wasn't anything like what the brochures made you believe. For one thing it was packed with native americans that didn't appreciate a settler walking in from nowhere.
Fuck El Dorado! Let's get the hell outta here!!1

Arrows to move left/right. Space to jump.
Avoid the spears. Have fun!

Written in around 15 hours. No Native Americans were harmed during the making of this game.

Edit: You cannot win, because that's how things roll in El Dorado!

entries.title: Huescape
entries.description:
You wake up in a strange place.  Smooth, alien surfaces all around you, a voice commands you forward to be tested.  You are a rat in an elaborate maze, and something is watching you, trying to learn something from your futile instinct to escape.

Huescape is a (very) short first-person puzzle platformer.  Use the traditional WASD/mouse controls to move around.  You'll figure out the rest.

Written with Unity 3 using some of the included standard assets (primarily the FPS character controller and the noise post-processing shader), starting about noon Saturday (EST) and submitted for the Jam Sunday about midnight (a couple hours after the competition closed).

Postmorten and details writeup are forthcoming - have fun, and thanks for playing :)

NOTE:  I've changed the web URL from DropBox to my own host so that I can see how many people are playing :)  They're the same files though, no post-jam changes.

entries.title: Impossible Escape
entries.description:
Finally, after 28 and a half hours of game development (I mean 28 and a half hours of straight work), I am proud to present my creation :D. It is a top down shooter where your goal is to escape from a military base of an oppressive, poor government. I had lots of fun doing this and I hope all of you did too! Cheers! =)

Also, I was getting very, very tired towards the end, so a lot of my later features are hard coded rather than systematically programmed :S

I really wish I had time to implement a story line, but I'm not the most creative person in the world. I implemented a dialogue system, but never ended up getting to use it :( But I will definitely build on this game!

entries.title: Lasertrap
entries.description:
You are Bob, a guy who somehow ended up imprisoned and is guarded only by lasers.

Good luck!

Requires XNA (http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=20914)

entries.title: Mazes & Demons
entries.description:
You wake up not knowing where you are. But you know one thing: you must ESCAPE!

To escape you must reach the ladder. Beware of demons, as they will chase you if they see you. You can turn your light off so they won't be able to see you.

Controls:
Keyboard Arrows - movement
Enter - select
F - toggle light on/off
D - run
M - mute music

Tools used:
Allegro5
Code::Blocks
Graphics Gale
sfxr
musagi

entries.title: Monster Hunt
entries.description:
Run away from angry mob. Avoid large stones and logs.

CONTROLS: 
<space> = Jump (The longer you press, the higher you jump)
<esc> = Exit

entries.title: Next Time I Won't Trust the Man in the White Van
entries.description:
'Next Time I Won't Trust the Man in the White Van' is a top down challenge/puzzle game by Josh Coughran (Maple) and Rory Higgins (Spaceoff), set, rather unimaginitively, in a dungeon.  Everything about the story is what you make of it, so without further ado:

Controls:  Arrow keys to move, R key to restart the level, M to toggle mute.  The game saves the last level you were on, which can be accessed with the Load button at the menu.
Edit: Noticed too late there's a problem with the keeping of the deaths stat, beating a level will accumulate a death, so don't feel heartbroken if you got a seemingly perfect run with 26 deaths or so.

The artwork, music and some level design was by Maple, the rest was by Spaceoff.

entries.description:
You are living on a spaceship, suddenly it is under attack.  Enemies are boarding and blowing the place up.  Get to an escape pod before it self destructs!

Left mouse button - shoots
Alt+Enter - toggle fullscreen (recommended)

entries.title: The Man Who Sold The World
entries.description:
The Man Who Sold The World

A bit of a less-literal, more metaphorical interpretation of the theme. Help define the destiny of humanity...
