entries.title: I'm Being Eaten By A Spider Queen (And I Don't Like It One Bit!)
entries.description:
If you've played Lesbian Spider Queens of Mars by Anna Anthropy (http://games.adultswim.com/lesbian-spider-queens-of-mars-twitchy-online-game.html), you might have wondered: what happens to the captured slaves when our dear Queen walks over them? The obvious answer is that they are abstracted away into a cage offscreen, instantaneously, in the manner of many videogames. The disobvious answer is that the Queen uses her spider-venom to shrink them down to a portable size, so she can carry them around freely, as if they were mere diamond gems. This game is based on this assertion to some extent.

All art assets were made in the standard Game Maker sprite editor.

ALERT: Contains adult themes, weird sexual nonsense, dubious arachnid biology and female nipples.

entries.title: Lava Tsunami of Doom
entries.description:
Run away from the dangerously upright lava tsunami!

Should be runnable in any modern browser with html5 and canvas support. Flash may be required for the sound engine.

I REALLY recommend running this in an up to date version of Google Chrome. It's the only browser I've tested it in properly and know it works.

----------------------

How to play:

A = move left
D = move right
Shift = sprint
S = duck/slide
Space = jump
Point and click to shoot!

You can destroy floating damaged blocks, double jump and propel yourself slightly with the force of your 6-shot revolver. It won't reload until all 6 shots have been fired!

----------------------

Libraries and tools used:

jQuery for javascript handiness
(http://jquery.com/)

Audiotool.com for background "music" generation
(http://www.audiotool.com/)

bfxr.net for sound effect generation
(http://www.bfxr.net/)

soundManager for better than native javascript sound support
(http://www.schillmania.com/projects/soundmanager2/)

chronolapse for timelapse screenshots and video generation
(http://keeyai.com/projects-and-releases/chronolapse/)

Photoshop for graphics!

entries.title: No Escape
entries.description:
Don't let the little men escape your wrath. Stomp them all!
Avoid the houses at all cost.

Press "A" or "Left Arrow" to lift left foot
Press "D" or "Right Arrow" to lift right foot
Press the button again when your foot is on air to stomp it.

My highest score is around 300.

Made with Flash AS3.
Sounds generated with as3sfxr.

entries.title: Prison Break
entries.description:
Incomplete, and the only thing I started with before the start of this event was a Tile class. Also i did use some engine code (game loop) from an old project.

Anyway, only one map, and unbalanced. The idea is you're supposed to stop the 'prisoners'(triangles) from escaping.

Controls:
Menu will pop out of the right, and you just click the tower you want. You can't highlight towers unfortunately and you can't see their range.

Gray Triangles are normal, Yellow are fast and weak, Red are slow but strong, and green are 'bosses'.

After Wave 5, the entities just stop updating, but I'd be amazed if you even bothered.

entries.title: Runner! .. and his problems.. 1.1
entries.description:
IMPORTANT FIX: I fixed the room_goto_next() thing now. If you still have problems, please don't hesitate to tell me!

Side note: If the screen is too small for you, you can   resize it, like you would be able to with any other window.

Jump with the space bar. 

The 'O+' Pickup generates two rocks at once ;) Try to avoid or go for dodging two obstacles at once

Play Music with right click on the speaker
and mute it with a left click ;)

It shouldn't be that terrible though.

"You angered King Blob. Now he's shooting giant rocks at you! RUN. For hells sake, RUN!"

entries.title: Spiders v. Aliens
entries.description:
I kind of ran out of time, so the story isn't clear.

Basically, these aliens kidnapped you and were about to kill you, but (for perfectly logical reasons) you had a bunch of alien gut spiders. They don't hurt you, but they kill the aliens on contact.

Use arrow keys to move. Press and hold WASD  (or their dvorak equivalents) to grab and drag stuff around.

Grab a portal to activate it. You can teleport objects with you by grabbing the portal with one hand while holding an object with another hand.

Some portals need a key to turn on the power.

Grab the cannons to shoot a lightning bolt.

There's also a ghost that can grab things, and it copies whatever you do. Find it and set it free: you'll need it to escape!

Made with flixel 2.5.... Seems to require the latest version of flash. (I couldn't get the swf to run in chrome, but it works in my firefox...)

entries.title: Unrest
entries.description:
Unrest is a game where you have the goal of escaping hopelessness. You are set upon by all the issues that plauge your life, and must fix them without creating too many issues, or making any one issue too big.

The issues you face scroll by in the background. As they become bigger issues, they become bigger, and if any one issue becomes too much, the game will end as you are overwhelmed. Likewise if you let everything build up, you will notice that the chance of espcaping hopelessness (visualised at the bottom of the screen) will fade.

If you start to sort out your life, the issues will reduce in size, and your goal of escaping hopelessness will become clearer.

It is intended that the game is very easy to loose, and juggling all of your issues is a hard task.

Note there are a few issues with the bindings, and the static versions. The best bet is to run the source version, if you can handle installing the dependancies. The Linux precompiled version will probably only work on 64-bit systems, and the Windows one may give some errors in a command prompt, and may 'crash' when you exit - but the game itself will work.

Overall, I'm happy I completed the task, and I hope the game is something a little bit different. I'm no artist, so the art and (lack of) animation is not great, and I feel I could have done better, but there we go.

entries.title: You've Seen This in the Movies
entries.description:
NOTE: I left a bug in there, you can jump once in mid-air, but only if you WALK off a platform. It IS mentioned in-game, and you DO have to use it once, at the first room, because I decided not to take it out, as 

NOTE 2: In order to use the source, you're going to have to have to set up the SDL library. 
http://lazyfoo.net/SDL_tutorials/lesson01/index.php

Okay, so... It's not really (at all) my best work, as I'm only starting out with C++ and the SDL library. But here it is...

You wake up in a cell all alone, a mysterious voice coming from, seemingly, nowhere.

Controls:

Left/Right - Move.
Up - Jump.
Z - Shoot.

entries.title: Abandoodle
entries.description:
EDIT: Fixed version just in time

It's my second time participating in LD!

The game is a quite short linear platformer, where you have to escape from a prison. All the graphics are hand-drawn and scanned to the computer.

Requires to run:

.NET Framework 4.0
http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=17851

XNA 4.0 Redist
http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=20914


I hope you enjoy this game even though it's not too long because I ran out of time.

entries.title: Aftermath!
entries.description:
Aftermath is the story of a looter trying to make it home from a hard day of looting.

You must guid the player across a busy highstreet filled with police. Then you must guide the player through a maze of streets to make it to his house while being chased by a policeman on foot.

There are some minor bugs with collision. Nothing too gamebraking i hope.

I hope you enjoy my entry for Ludum Dare 21. :)

It is a light hearted take on current events/affairs and in no way supports rioting or looting.

entries.title: Antagonist
entries.description:
This is in some ways a 2d de-make of a 3d game idea that I'll probably never get round to actually making.

It's relatively typical flash platformer fare. However the antagonist is far away from typical anything, and it's coming to get you!

wsad or arrow keys to move, space or z to jump if that's more comfy for you.  Hope you enjoy it :-)

Special prize to whoever manages to complete it sub 3 minute run without dying?

entries.title: BATHOS
entries.description:
*** DON'T READ COMMENTS! Until you've played the game! Thanks!  ***

Instructions inside the game. Please play before reading comments in case of spoilers. Thanks and good luck!

entries.title: BombusaXX
entries.description:
BombusaXX - by Daniel Horne


This is a clone of an old game that came with my Atari ST - Bombuzal

How to play
-----------

The idea is to detonate all of the bombs on the level. Without killing yourself.
To detonate a bomb, you go to that square and press space to trigger the bomb - it will then fire when you leave the square.

There are three sizes of bomb - the smallest will destroy the tile they're on and set off any bombs in the surrounding squares
the medium size bomb will destroy adjacent squares as well, triggering any other bombs in a two-square radius.
the large bomb will destroy an area of 3 square radius (triggering secondary explosions in any other bombs in the 4 square radius circle)

Complicating matters, there are other types of tile
"Fragile" tiles can only be stepped on once and will disintegrate when you leave them.
"Ice" tiles, on which you cannot stop - if you enter a patch of ice tiles you'll skid all the way to the other end.
"slot" tiles, which allow you to move the bombs to other adjacent slotted tiles. (To do this, press "p" to pick up or drop the bomb).

Development
-----------

BombusaXX was developed in c++ with Visual studio Express 10. Though I reused some window-and-opengl setup code from other projects of mine, there was no framework involved beyond that.

Graphics are done in the Gimp.

Didn't get around to doing sound.. It was on the todo list but I ran out of time.

entries.title: D.T.R.J
entries.description:
Here be my third Ludum Dare entry.

Take control of our locked away hero using the arrow or W, A, S, D keys.

By harnessing the power of his electromagnet bracelet and pressing the "X" or "CTRL" keys you may move pesky blocks barricading our friend from his escape.

With thought and care he can traverse the level and open a pathway to the goal, the teleporter. Entering this teleporter shall transport our hero to a new location and a new challenge.

Should a challenge become too difficult or terrifying to confront, press the "R" key to reset the level and try once more.

entries.title: Dot Matrix
entries.description: You have been abducted by aliens who want to probe you. In the name of their 'science' and because they just like it. But you escape there cell and now need to use there own teleports to find your way back home. Story is not well put into the game i had plans to do an animated intro but didnt have time to complete some story driven features. Movement: A+D Jump: Space Action: E Hope you enjoy the game. Timelapse: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MIK2laz_T2c

entries.title: Enrique Iglesias' deadly a capella performance in a mall
entries.description:
In 2001 people in the United States were terrified. Something terrible had happened. Something that frightened even the bravest ones. Enrique Iglesias released a new album in English: Escape.

There was more. Enrique decided to make surprise appearences around the States. In shopping malls. It was said that listening to his new songs would blow your mind. Literally.

In the game you are a shopping mall security guard. You should protect visitors from him. You should find Enrique Iglesias among the visitors and click on him. Then, people could escape from Enrique.

But fail and people would listen to him.

entries.title: Escape from XYZ
entries.description:
Explore the dangerous halls of XYZ in an homage to the metal gear solid gameboy game. 

The game is finished from the mechanical standpoint. Sadly there aren't that many levels.

The controls are arrowkeys(or wasd) for movement and space for menu navigation. The rest will be explained ingame.

When the game runs to slow. Disable PostProcessing in Options.
For a better challenge.. disable enemy sight cone in options.

This game was written purely in java without external libraries. 
made by SaiKai and Dero

entries.title: Gunz And Sedanzz
entries.description:
Sometimes a man just has to get away from it all.




Some poorer documented things:

arrow keys do things too
sitting dodges bullets
police shoot past the car if you aren't in it
hold the push button and walk to push the car

entries.title: Make a run for It
entries.description:
---- SPACE ----
Adventure, Freedom, Interesting people ... Which want to blow your sorry a** out of the skies. You don't have much options, make a run for it!

You're the hardened chief mechanic on board of a space freighter piloted mainly by noobs. 
And now you've discovered a asteroid field. Wich is surrounded by pirates. That have bond with your enemies of war. Dang.

Hold that ship together as long as you can, you'll hope that the old girl will make it to the jumpgate out of this system.

entries.title: Metal Sphere Solid
entries.description:
Escape the evil Cuboids with your sneaky sphere in this adventurous physics-puzzler!

You are a Sphere, taken prisoner by the evil Cuboids. Try to escape. Avoid Enemies. Avoid being seen. Be sneaky. Be stealthy. Escape!

Features:
- Asthetically interesting environment
- Atmospheric soundtrack
- Physics-based controls
- A heartwrenching story about friendship and escape!
- Highscore-system, so you keep coming back to kick more ass
- Geometry-based adversaries and allies
- Completely unrealistic glowing spheres.
- The largest amount of story I ever put in a game

Controls:
Arrow-keys - movement
WSAD - movement
M - mute sound
R - restart level

Also uploaded, in addition to web- and windows-files: A timelapse of me building it and the soundtrack.

Have Fun!

-Matthew

UPDATES

I got a review!
http://jayisgames.com/archives/2011/08/metal_sphere_solid.php

And I wrote a post-mortem. Go read.
http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2011/08/28/thoughts-on-metal-sphere-solid-a-post-mortem-if-you-will/

Another review!
http://gaming.thedigitalfix.com/content/id/283/just-browsing-ludum-dare-special.html

entries.title: North Korean Escape
entries.description:
Requires XNA 4.0: http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/info.aspx?na=41&srcfamilyid=a88c6dec-aeae-42cd-a108-d35c013c3b97&srcdisplaylang=en&u=http%3a%2f%2fdownload.microsoft.com%2fdownload%2fA%2fC%2f2%2fAC2C903B-E6E8-42C2-9FD7-BEBAC362A930%2fxnafx40_redist.msi

.Net Framework 4.0: 
http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/info.aspx?na=41&srcfamilyid=9cfb2d51-5ff4-4491-b0e5-b386f32c0992&srcdisplaylang=en&u=http%3a%2f%2fdownload.microsoft.com%2fdownload%2f1%2fB%2fE%2f1BE39E79-7E39-46A3-96FF-047F95396215%2fdotNetFx40_Full_setup.exe

Help secure the borders of Best Korea by eliminating those who would seek to leave.

Controls:
W - Forward
Mouse Move - Aim
Left Click - Primary Fire
Right Click - Alt Fire

Don't run out of ammo or it's game over!
Get to 1,000,000 Points to win!

entries.title: Planet RED
entries.description:
this is my first LD entry
made with GM8

controls mouse+w a s d

l mouse button = shoot/select
w a s d = move
moving mouse = aim

a little glitchy BTW

entries.title: Prison Break
entries.description: This is a rail shooter where the player must suppress a escaping prisoners with bullets.

entries.title: Reality
entries.description: The idea came from many nights playing video games as an escape from reality. We've all had moments where we just wanted to take a break from real life but sometimes you just have to challenge it head on.

entries.title: Rescue Support
entries.description:
Watch the playthrough here http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VvMJYaJ_DJ0

DESCRIPTION:
Rescue Support is a game wherein you take control of a rescue ship and help out your comrades who are escaping the monster horde.

THE TWIST:
The unique twist I made with this game is that you take the role as support. You have no guns that you can fire but you do get to help out the team by dropping turrets to help with killing enemies, and health packs to regenerate health. 

The more people you rescue and bring back to your base, the more money you get for equipment and upgrades.

CONTROLS:
- Control Arrows for movement
- Z for buying and picking up items

SOME NOTES:
- For this game I concentrated on the gameplay and less on graphics and sound.
- Didn't have time to include an endgame. Basically just try to get the most number of kills and saves

SOME TIPS:
- Flinging really helps
- Try to set up a camp with turrets, soldiers and medpack and see your score and money rise

entries.title: Something embarrassingly bad
entries.description:
This is really just a proof of concept that something like this could be done in SVG + Javascript (apparently it can), but it might briefly entertain a certain kind of person.

Longer-term it's supposed to be a logic puzzle game, which may explain why most of the development time was taken up getting side-tracked and solving logic puzzles and drafting terrible stories to go in the left-hand panel.

entries.title: Super Kommandant Exteme
entries.description:
Super Kommandant Extreme is based around two main ideas, Light as a limited resource and Hogan's Heroes perspective on prison camp Kommandants, the idea being that while people were off fighting in the war the kommandants stayed home and lived the life of the party. The only real thing they feared was having their command taken away from them, so you better stop those prisoners or you'll be wearing snow boots on the eastern front!

At the start of the LD i had the option of doing nice or quick and dirty code, i chose the latter so if you look at my source be prepared for horror.

Programmed in Java, nothing else :P
Sound tools were Audacity and Sibelius!
Graphics were made by a little program called ArtIconsPro and the logo was created using OpenOffice.



Quick instructions for people who do not want to read the ingame ones:

WASD / left mouse grab and drag : navigate the map.
Moving the mouse : watch tower beams follow your curser.
Right mouse button : Fire machine gun.

Watch tower beams when the large part is held over a prisoner (they will stop moving) for long enough will cause them to vanish back to their barracks, do this!

Only shoot them if they get outside the fence! killing guys inside of the fence will cause you to lose very quickly!

entries.title: The great escape of Dr. Diabito!
entries.description:
The game is made in flash so it will run in your browser. There are alot of stuff on the screen so it might lag a bit. Enjoy the game!

There are about 4 playable levels, but currently the game has no proper ending. The background will simply go black after the meteor rain. You'll know what im talking about.

entries.title: Thruster
entries.description:
I wasn't able to finish my procedurally generated RPG in time, so I restarted and made this.

Better to submit something than nothing ;-)

Should work on windows 95 / NT4 and upward.

Control with cursor keys.
Source code is included in the zip.

entries.title: Towering Inferno
entries.description:
You are a fireman trapped at the top of a burning skyscraper. You have only your axe and some water. 
Get to the exit, taking as many helpless bystanders with you as possible. The fire is already spreading...

---

Towering Inferno is a roguelike firefighting game where water and fire interact in interesting ways. You can never extinguish the flames, but maybe you can control them, and escape the building. 

It was written in C++ with libtcod. You can find me on twitter @tenpn, and the devlog for this game is online at http://tenpn.tumblr.com .

To run, you'll need to install the Visual C++ runtime: http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=5555

EDIT:
Man! A typo on the GUI suggests that you should use the A key to activate it, but it's actually the X key.

links.label: Linux (ported by a third party, but identical source)

entries.title: Viral
entries.description:
Viral is a 2D top-down escape game. You are a Virus. The objective of the game is to escape the anti-viruses who are trying to catch you, to delete you, for as long as possible. There is no win condition.

There are three viruses with different behaviors:
Scanner(Purple Magnifying Glass): Slow, but will always follow you
Integrity Checker(Blue Alarm): Will only give chase if you get too close
Emulator(Yellow E): Fast and will hone in on you. Only lasts for 30 seconds at a time.

To aid in your evasion you are given two traps to use:
[/0] - Logic Bomb - Roots the first anti-virus who runs into it in place for 5 seconds
[?] - EPO - After a 2 second activation period, the EPO will become part of the map for 13 seconds and block anything around it

Known Bugs:
Anti-virus pathing is still a little iffy at times. I ran out of time to polish it. I'm sorry!
You will experience some slowdowns if a lot of anti-viruses need to generate paths all at the same time. As above, I wasn't able to fix it in time!
No music disable feature - Ran out of time!

I hope you enjoy my first Ludum Dare entry and endure the programmer tier art and last second music. Thank-you!

entries.title: 8 ways
entries.description:
Here is my entry for my first Ludum Dare. Initially I wanted to make a game similar to a virus, which couldn't be killed. But it was not in my skill's scope...

So I did this game. I don't know if it's really fun, but I tried to do something which I like myself.

Here is the pitch : the avatar is trapped in a succession of rooms, and there are 8 ways to escape. Are you going to find all of them?

EDIT : Downloadable version added for Windows 32 & 64 bit and several for Os/X  (I didn't know which one I should build with Unity so I built all the existent possibility )

entries.title: Apocalypse Escape
entries.description:
I ran out of time on this one so there are a few things left un-done. The physics still has problems on some machines and I didn't get time to add sound effects. However the game is playable and I'm pleased to have got it done in the 48 hours!

You have to help your colonists escape the apocalypse by building them a safe bunker and then enduring five destructive attacks in the form of a flood, a plague, a hurricane, an earthquake and an a-bomb. There are three difficulty levels. I hope you enjoy it!

entries.title: Bloppo: the great escape
entries.description:
Challenge your sense of orientation in 'Bloppo: the great escape'!

I've made this game with Game Maker 8.0.
Graphics have been done with Game Maker's sprite editor and the GIMP 2.6.
Music have been composed with Anvil Studio and transformed to MP3 with Hamienet's online tool, and the guitar tracks have been recorded with my BC Rich Virgo guitar, my Peavey Vypyr 30 amp, and Guitar Rig 4.

entries.title: Bubba's Escape
entries.description:
Bubba's Escape is a block sliding puzzle game where you have to guide Bubba out of his workplace storage facility before his angry boss comes to yell at you!

This was my 1st LD48 ever so I started with very simple game design =) but I reached my goal and actually finished something, which is nice.

Controls:
Left mouse button - Select objects in the game area
Right mouse button - Undo

ps. Code is total mess (full of quick and dirty fixes)

entries.title: Caved In
entries.description:
Caved In was inspired by Minecraft, Terraria, Dwarf Fortress, and dungeon crawlers. The goal of the game is to ascend all five levels to the surface. Along the way you can collect treasures and save a few stranded ladies. Lava and water flow to fill gaps and will kill you if you stay in them too long. Full instructions in-game.

As regards to everyone have problems with walls:
You must hold either SHIFT or Z and then press UP/DOWN/LEFT/RIGHT or W/A/S/D for the respective direction. If you have 2 or more bricks (which are gained from mining stone blocks) a wall will be created. You can't create a wall if you are too close to another object. Hope that helps. =]

entries.title: Don't ESCape
entries.description:
This is a short game made entirely in Blender and using the Blender Game Engine.
Currently you need Blender to play this game. (You can get it from http://www.blender.org/ or http://graphicall.org/blender  It should be possible to create a standalone version. I will try.).

Open the file in Blender and you are good to go.

Press 'P' to start the game-mode.
Use the arrow-keys to rotate the platform. That will move the ball.
And you need to keep track of your mouse-arrow sometimes ... Be prepared ;-)

You can always ESCape ;-)

------------------------------------------
Edit 1:

Grab an easy downloadable version here:
http://code.google.com/p/manuel-bellersen/downloads/detail?name=Dont_ESCape.blend

Maybe the online-version works for someone: http://urfoex.blogspot.com/2011/08/ld21-entry-dont-escape.html 

------------------------------------------

Edit 2:

I added a binary for Linux 64Bit:
http://manuel-bellersen.googlecode.com/files/Dont_ESCape.7z
It *should* work...

------------------------------------------

Edit 3:

Just added 2 binaries for Windows, one for 
32Bit ( http://code.google.com/p/manuel-bellersen/downloads/detail?name=Dont-ESCape-32Bit.exe&can=2&q= ) 
and another for 
64Bit ( http://code.google.com/p/manuel-bellersen/downloads/detail?name=Dont-ESCape-64Bit.exe&can=2&q= ).

Have Fun!

------------------------------------------

Edit 4:

I've written a little Post-blabla:
https://plus.google.com/116768004614082942458/posts/SMSc1gZFYky

And if you need help on how to play level one you can find a little play-hint in comment #6.

entries.title: DRUGSDRUGSDRUGS
entries.description:
(If the website doesn't load, just refresh a few times)

DRUGSDRUGSDRUGS - play as a drug addict in this crazy colourful beat 'em up!

In this game you can:
Punch Doctors!
Walk on your head!
Get a highscore!
Defy gravity!
Get high!
...punch some more Doctors!
Break the highscore!

The link to the theme - Drugs are your 'escape from reality'. Yeah.

Instructions in game.
(Arrow Keys to move and jump, Z to punch, punch doctors to get drugs to keep you craving bar full)

TIPS:
Jump over the doctors then punch them from behind!
Doctors can't punch you if you're in the air either.

Created in AS3 with Flashpunk.

The Newgrounds version is slightly improved, with music and stuff, so don't rate that one, use the Web link.

I originally wanted to add more enemies, and possibly more types of drugs, but hey, I only had 48 hours. I didn't have time to do music or sound effects or anything, so sorry about the silent game.

entries.title: Escaparazzi
entries.description:
Escape from the Paparazzi! Don't let them take too many pictures or you'll be lost! Avoid the cars and cross your fingers, let's hope you make it 'til the taxi arrives!

Controls:

WASD or Directional Arrows.

Software & Libraries:

Flixel <- old version, 2.3 (not sure) I think that the current version is suffering from feature creep. (Tho the allure of Flixel Power tools is strong)

Flash Develop <- Love this IDE.

Pixel Bender <- I made the camera flash with this. Really fast and powerful tool for simple shader work.

Aria Maestosa <- really simple midi sequencer (and Flight of the Bumblebee was one of the first songs I learnt on piano, so i tought, why not?)

GXSCC <- Pretty lame I know, but i wanted the oldschool sound without having to learn how to use a mod tracker during a 48hr compo :-p

Audacity <- Easiest way to record, remix and export sound.

ASEPRITE <- The oldschool feel, yet powerful feature set makes me all fuzzy inside.

SFXR <- I think we are all familiar with this piece of sheer brilliance.

entries.title: Escape from Cube Mountain
entries.description:
My first time trying this, I created a simple "chase to the border" game.  The objective is to make it to the edge of the map.

I used xna game studio 4, paint.net, and sfxr.  3D objects were created by just typing out the coordinates in code as they are all simple primitives.  Terrain is random seed based so each level is the same.

I took one peek at some old code for camera axis vector extraction, but other than that it was all done on the fly.

Plays well on netbooks, and controls with either keyboard or 360 gamepad.

REQUIREMENTS:
Windows XP, Windows Vista, or Windows 7
XNA Framework Redist:  http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=20914
.NET Framework 4.0 Redist:  http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=17851

entries.title: Escape from the Depths
entries.description:
Did not have as much time as I wanted to this weekend.  The game is lacking many features I had planned to put in.  It is at least playable.

Your submarine has sprung a leak in it's ballast.  Attempt to collect air from passing bubbles and make it to the surface.  Save your men!

Left/Right arrow keys for movement.
Up key to let air out from the ballast.

Collect air to rise, avoid the Depth Charges from above.

entries.title: Escape The Void
entries.description: Save files created in the same directory of the EXE, starting a new game and hitting the first atom will result in your save being overwritten.

entries.title: Escape the Wolf: OHR
entries.description:
ESCAPE THE WOLF!

Run AWAY!

...but if you run too long, you get tired.

And where is that dang cabin anyway? This forest is HUGE!

---------------------------------------------------------

Created with the OHRRPGCE (although I ended up scripting almost everything)

For the Linux OHRRPGCE player, go here:
http://rpg.hamsterrepublic.com/ohrrpgce/Linux_Notes
Just use the escapewolf.rpg data file from either the Windows or the Mac zip file.

(although escapewolf.exe works in wine if you are lazy)

Game data is escapewolf.rpg
Game scripts are escapewolf.hss

entries.title: Extreme Beatboxing Bird Jailbreak
entries.description:
Help your bird pals escape from bird jail through the power of beatboxing! I recommend having some musical experience before playing this game, otherwise you will probably suck. Feel free to prove me wrong!

Made with GameMaker, Paint.net, and Sonar Home Studio.

Have fun!

entries.title: Fires & Fights
entries.description:
Fires & Fights is a web-based (HTML / CSS / JS) two-player game about escaping a confined space. Player One controls the blue square (WASD to move, Q to open windows, E to put out fires) while Player Two controls the pink square (IJKL to move, U to open windows, O to put out fires). Work together, or you'll burn alone.

Two players are required. Sorry if that's a hassle. This is my gift to those of you with significant others who were neglected over the last 48 hours, bring him/her in to play with you. In my own playtesting, I found that the close proximity required to play with two people on one keyboard results in greater than average amounts of snuggling. Enjoy.

See the tutorial on the site for more specifics about gameplay. I wrote and tested the game using Chrome for OS X, and have tested it in Firefox as well, but besides those browsers...there be dragons.

I've written up a post-mortem about how the game came to be and the inspirations behind it, which you can read here: http://samuelfine.com/firesandfights/dc.php. If you want to learn more, follow me on Twitter @54mf.

Thanks for playing.

entries.title: In Chains
entries.description:
In Chains is a 2D platformer. I created it using OpenGL, GLEW, SOIL, and OpenAL-Soft. The game is very short, and the ending isn't much, but I hope you enjoy at least the little bits that are there.

(Warning, the source code is very messy!)

entries.title: Maze++
entries.description:
The level design is awful, I didn't really have time, but I was partly saved by GIMP's maze generating plugin :D
I wanted to write an "Escape the Maze", but with eye candy and some new features, like destructible walls, super-colliding-super-buttons and one-way walls. I pretty much succeeded, despite having completely changed what I was aiming for at the beginning of day 2. I'm much more pleased with this than my LD19 entry, despite less completion.
Written with Flex 4 and Flixel, on Ubuntu Linux ;)

entries.title: Pastagus Fantasy
entries.description:
This game has been made by a team of three peoples called the Uchuu Sentai Pastagaga. 

This is our first participation to Ludum Dare Jam so be gentle :) 

In this shoot em up game you cannot shoot, you can just avoid the bullet. So let's name it an "avoid them all" game. 

The more you avoid bullets, the more you score. Each bullet that goes out of the screen makes you earn 1 point. 
Your score fulfil a power gauge which allow you to active one of your 4 powers : 

1- Shield: glass shields block the bullets
2- Nova: generate a nova circle around your ship and destroy all the bullets in it
3- Mirror ball: makes the entire screen go BOOM and empty it
4- Score x2: all bullets that go out of the screen make you earn 2 points !

The idea behind the game is not just to "escape" the bullets. It is to "escape" reality. Firstly through the universe of the game and secondly because in the real world you will never just avoid the bullets without shooting.

As you will see the game needs some improvements, balancing and lack from real musics and SFX. But don't worry ! This is just the first version. Updates will come soon :)

We hope you'll like the game in this first release. Do not hesitate to drop a word, feedback, comments, anything will be appreciate. See you for another Jam :) 

Gameplay video : http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ze7iF8JWjUs

entries.title: Quean Bee
entries.description:
My first game jam, and I heeded the wisdom of McFunkypants regarding the avoidance of noob mistakes, going with something very simple.

A 2-player game: get your lovely bees across to the other side of the screen, but stop the other player from getting their bees across. Bees sting each other when they meet and die shortly afterwards.

Would good games seem as good if there weren't bad ones to compare them too? Do my terrible graphics somehow benefit the community by providing a low-water reference point?

entries.title: Red-Line to Shady Grove
entries.description:
I based this game off of a scene from the movie "The French Connection" (see if you can guess which one). 

The purpose of the game is to lose your pursuers by getting on a train without them following you. I had a lot of fun creating some of the more chaotic train stations for the later levels. 

This is my first Ludum Dare and it was a lot of fun. I hope you like my game.

entries.title: Self Destruct: Activated
entries.description:
You've defeated the evil aliens, and triggered their base's self destruct mechanism. The only problem? Your ship is on the other side of the base! Your only chance to escape is to outrun the explosion!

Arrow keys - move/aim
Z - jump
X - shoot

You get pushed in the opposite direction when firing the gun. Use this to your advantage when faced with seemingly impossible jumps.

entries.title: Space Escape
entries.description:
You are a small, poorly animated spaceship moving through poorly drawn space. You have been trapped in a grid of forcefields. You have but one option. ESCAPE.

Use the arrow keys or WASD to move. Once moving, you will not stop until you hit a forcefield. Press ESC or P to pause. Good Luck.

entries.title: The Shadows Hunger
entries.description:
Here's The Shadows Hunger. The darkness will consume you, so run from light to light, collecting the items you need to escape and avoiding the shadowy beasts that would devour you!
Instructions and journal included.
Try #2: Replacing with version that corrects a mistake in the instructions.

entries.title: Tongue, tip of the
entries.description:
Made in Game Maker: Text-Adventure... with a twist.

'Don't you hate it when words just escape you, on the tip of your tongue - so to speak.'

WASD to move.
Left clicky-click buttons with the mouse.
No sound - ran out of time ^^

Hosted at my website: 

http://nizan.weebly.com/ludum-dare-21.html

My first Ludum Dare complete! :)

entries.title: Walls of Darkness
entries.description:
You are an adventurer who had the bad idea to plunder a cursed temple.

The wall begins to close on you. You have to escape... But even in this situation, you want to satisfy your greed an take as much treasure as you can!

Good Luck =)

Edit : I just realized that you need an effect to open the .cap
it's here http://dl.dropbox.com/u/23551572/LD21/Textured%20Lerp%20Tinting.fx

Code Construct Classic
Sound Design : Sfxr & Audacity
Music : freeplaymusic.com

entries.title: AWAYGET
entries.description:
DESCRIPTION
Your buddy is making a break for it, but unfortunately he's not too fast or bright. Luckily he has a friendly sniper to help him out, you! Shoot goons, take out spotlights, and direct your friend to safety!

CONTROLS
Mouse to aim, left-click to shoot. Click on your friend to toggle his movement (stop/move). Click above him to jump.

OTHER NOTES
The game is just two levels so it's not a complete title honestly. Think of it like a bare prototype. :)

Made using Flashpunk, some bits from Flixel, FlashDeveloper, Photoshop (graphics), sfxr (sound).

entries.title: Beam Runner
entries.description:
Moved to jam because it's been updated kinda heavily content wise and I'd rather you look at that than what I had <24 hours ago.

Still no sound, hahah.

Made a lot of tweaks to the editor and UI in general. An about page might be nice later I guess.

Tutorial still isn't a tutorial, I got sidetracked making the editor more bearable and including instructions in-game because everyone ignores readmes. I'll add some instructions to the tutorial later on if I get time for some postcompo work.

Again:

Arrows To Move.
Down To Use Keys.

--------------- ORIGINAL NOTES ----------------

Going to call it a night. There isn't a level progression there as I've run out of time, but I'm pleased with what is there.

Arrows To Move.
Down To Use Keys.

ReadMe for everything else ;)

entries.description: Escape the sea.

entries.description:
~~~ Controls:

Z = sprint
