entries.title: Captive
entries.description:
CAPTIVE
A game by Nate Wiesel
for Ludum Dare 21


You awaken in a strange, unfamiliar place. All you know is that you need to escape.

There is a post-compo update that fixes some major bugs. Here's the list of changes from 1.00 to 1.03:

-Added a few tiles to some rooms to make them slightly less dull.
-Fixed a music bug with the red terminal (for real this time)
-Added a secret 4th Boomka game you can unlock after beating the red terminal.
-Added a "portal" object to a single room. It's related to the secret.
-Made it so that checkpoints remember what key cards and doors are open when you save (as well as other variables, such as the music playing). This prevents you from grabbing a keycard, getting killed, but keeping the keycard after respawning.
-Added sounds for the fireballs.
-Randomized the fireball-pipe's first alarm a tiny bit.
-Fireballs now destroy when they fall off the edge of the screen.
-Made it so that using a terminal will reset the "used" status of checkpoints, so you can save again if you've just played a Boomka game.
-Removed a couple of very frustrating spikes.
-Moved around and added a couple of turrets, as well as some fireball-pipes.
-Closed one of the exits early in the game, past a blue door. Turns out I never added a room past there. Silly me. :p
-Refined the controls a bit. Feels a lot less slippery.
-Added version number to the opening.
-Fixed a few broken tiles
-Added simple particle effects for sparks and blood.

entries.title: Carol and The Haunted Castle
entries.description:
Made using:

Coding:
Game Maker 8.1

Music and sounds:
Guitar Pro
ChordPulse
Mixcraft

Graphics:
Charas Project
Paint (Win7)
Paint.net


Plot: "Help Carol to escape from the Haunted Castle"

I didn't have enough time to create more rooms, puzzles or songs, but I'm almost satisfied with the 2.5D coding and the look and feel of the game.

The main "song" (actually a couple of chords) was made using Guitar Pro, hope you like it.

Hope you like the game too... use arrows to move and space to jump :) ... F4: fullscreen


2011-08-23 FIX: Please don't consider this for the compo, but I just realized that the characters are not centered when playing the game in a notebook with integrated GPU. The issue was that textures dimensions are not power of 2. I change it in a new version. So if you experiment the graphic issue please try the new version. (I didn't add anything just change the texture dimensions). More info in my journal

entries.title: Cave Runner
entries.description:
Hey there!

This here game is my first Ludum Dare entry.

After raiding a dragon's treasure trove you seek to escape with all the gold you can. In order to avoid dropping any you need to do bunch of dodging and flinging of your sword.

Features:
- Random level generation!
- Basic physics!
- Multiple endings.
- In-game control list.

IMPORTANT:
If you've not run an Xna game before you will need to install:

(The XNA re-distributable):
http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=20914

(You may also need the latest version of .NET):
http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=17718

entries.title: Coin Runner
entries.description:
Run from the purple squares and collect coins as you go. 
Buy upgrades to get further and submit you score to the leaderboard.

*** Note: The difficulty of the enemies are not reset when you die. Please refresh the page occasionally or they will get really hard!! ***

Also note: The leaderboard times out when loading sometimes.
Scores seem to get submitted properly though. 
Also there's a bug making you restart with R if you write it in the highscore name box. Your best score is saved though, so just die and enter your name again. Copy and paste an r from somewhere. :P

Update: Apparently Playtomic leaderboards are disabled at the moment. Should be working soon.
Update: The leaderboard seems to be working now!
Update: Not yet. :(
Update: Mostly working now!

entries.title: Escape Run
entries.description:
This is Escape Run.

It mainly runs on windows.
Linux requires WINE, or running from source.
If you want to try to run from source on linux or mac, and you're familiar with python dependencies, the dependencies are pygame and pybox2d (I'm currently using pybox2d revision 355 but other recent revisions should also work.  I put a copy here: http://www.bleepbloop.org/files/ludumdare/ld21/pybox2d_rev355.zip
You can often install pybox2d with "python setup.py install" and/or easy_install.

Running:
Windows: unzip and run "main.exe"
Linux: have wine installed.  unzip and run "wine main.exe"
        or see "From source" below to run from source.
OSX: see "From source" below if you want to try this
From source: install dependencies pygame and pybox2d and run "python main.py" 

Use keys: wasd to move.
To aim: use ijkl or arrow keys, or use mouse (just move mouse to aim, you don't need to click)
Note: mouse aiming quality may not be as good since it was tested on a laptop.

Use Space to restart.

It gets progressively more difficult.
It's not as finished as I'd like, but it's playable. Many details like points and hitpoints weren't finished, and difficulty could have used more testing and tweaking.  Also, the background/visible level doesn't change.  The idea turned out a lot like "Smash TV", but a lot less finished :)

You get three hitpoints to start with.
Good luck! :)

Edits:
  added a more description so you know what to expect.
  added directions for pybox2d dependencies.
  added note on running on Linux with wine, and created Linux download link (same as link to windows download).
Aug 30:  Fix two problems making the game unplayable:
  - mouse aiming was completely broken on windows (it worked in linux, wine, and a VM).  Now it works -- keyboard aiming is probably still easier than mouse aiming if your keyboard allows many buttons pressed at once.
  - low resolution monitors could not play.  They are now detected and half size is used.  This can be forced with cmd-line arg "--small".

entries.title: Escape to the Stars
entries.description: So this is our entry into the competition.  Unfortunately it didn't go as planned at first due to technical issues, but luckily we found a plan B and made do with the time we had left.  It's not as complete as we wanted, but we will update it routinely outside of the competition.  Which will increase the interactivity substantially.  Thank you all for checking us out.

entries.title: Fierce Undead
entries.description:
You're a survivor that had the unfortunate event of being quarantined inside a city with a bunch of zombies!  Luckily you did get to contact help, but they won't be able to help you escape for 2 weeks.

The game is open-world and basically you're stuck inside a sectioned off part of the city.  There are buildings to explore and items and weapons to get.  I would suggest to constantly be on the look out for item boxes (which you can search for items in, but you can only get 1 item per item box per day (respawns at 8:00am)).

Anyways your goal is to survive for 2 weeks in the zombie infested area, so help can reach you to escape.  Controls can be found on the title screen.

Don't forget to check out the time lapse video!

entries.title: Forklift Escape
entries.description:
Forklift escape!

Escape from your evil employer to freedom!

Developed by: Allan Hollenberg
Designed by: Dennis Brinkhuis


FFFFFFFUUUUUUUUUUUU MAJOR bug which elimiates all game-play :( plus all the levels got removed D: D: D: D: 

WHY GOD WHY!!!!!!! 


I reverted to an older but playable build for the entry. sorry :(

entries.title: Glissaria
entries.description: Help save the world of Glissaria in an action packed mix of tower defense, match3, and rpg elements!

entries.title: I Predict a Riot
entries.description:
I Predict a Riot is not as funny as my usual LD entries, however similar to all my previous entries, it's not very much fun.

You are a high ranking prisoner in a prison, and its the night of the jailbreak. 

The other prisoners have put you in charge of distracting the guards whilst the other escape.

No failure state, no real winning state. Just a concept really, I quite like it, but its taken me 72 hours and now I want rid of it!

I noticed there was a bug in level 2 where the prisoners do not count as escaping, I'm looking into this.

Unfortunately please be aware that the tutorial runs at a shocking framerate, however it improves there after, I am looking into optimising the tutorial.

Made with Game Maker 8 and tested on Windows 7, I went a bit crazy with the screen size and its resolution is 1024,480.

Apologies, didn't add www. to entry link, can now download!

entries.title: Mate Escape (LD)
entries.description:
I finally made it! My 1st Ludum Dare!
Mate Escape! Help our desperate groom escape his wedding and meetup with his secret spouse! Is he fast enough to catch up with her car?

Controls:

Left/Right Arrow keys - Move
Space Key - Jump
Down Arrow Key - Duck
Ctrl Key [Hold] - Focus (Slow Motion)
Esc - Quit Game
F Key - Switch Screen to Fullscreen
W Key - Switch Screen to Window

The game feels it needs a lot stuff, the art took me a lot of time to make. The music is reaaaally simple as it isn't my forte + I was running out of time. I was planning to add more levels, story, enemies, powerups, achievements. But 48 hours is never enough, no? ;)

I liked the weird concept I came up with though. I might expand this into a proper game later if people like it. :)

The motivation and ideas I got out of this Ludum Dare is my personal contest "prize".

Enjoy! Don't get pecked too much!

*Windows build works on XP/Vista/7 (Extract all the files/folders from the zip first)

**Source requires Game Maker 8.1 + the extensions installed from the zip

entries.title: Mirror's Secret
entries.description:
Short platformer fighting game based on running away, and getting trapped.
Made with Processing and Paint.Net. Music made using Audacity and Anvil Studio.
First LD competition that I've entered.

**Note!**
In one place, the space is only 1 tile tall. It's difficult to pass through! It's not supposed to be difficult, though, so step back to the bottom of the stairs and then jump at it if you're having trouble. Just keep trying and you'll get through.

entries.title: Mountain Break
entries.description:
Escape the mountain and the lava within using
only your athletic ability your trusty Hazardous
Environment suit.

TIMELAPSE: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5xWFk9VPz1U

entries.title: Ninja Princess
entries.description:
First ever Ludum Dare...Sparkles!!

Html and javascript
Aptana, Gimp, and Firefox for development

Use ADSW and arrow keys...bats have a slow down effect
Using arrow keys allow u to destroy blocks

Seems to work better in Firefox than Chrome
May take a sec to load

entries.title: Rainbow Jail
entries.description:
You must escape the terrifying Rainbow Jail island.
On you way you can rescue others prisoners or use them to protect yourself.

- Move you character with the arrow keys or WASD
- Walk in single blocks to push them
- Walk in multiples blocks to destroy them

/!\ When you destroy a block, you destroy all the blocks of the same color in your area !
/!\ If you make a move in a sentry Area, you're dead meat.

If you leave the jail or achieve to collect the 16 diamonds, please post hero so I know if Rainbow Jail is actually finishable or not ^__^
( I hope it is because I lost too much time on this ending sequence... *sigh* )

entries.title: Safari Park Escape
entries.description:
An attempt at a kind of strategy roguelike, but I was way too ambitious and it's missing all the complexity that would make it interesting.

Take control of a group of animals escaped from a safari park and try to evade your captors for long enough that they eventually forget about you and you can finally live free in the countryside.

No sound. Partly because it doesn't seem particularly necessary, mainly because I ran out of time.

entries.title: Snake Plissken: Surfin' U.S.A.
entries.description:
Decided to go for a bit of parody based on the name with a corny movie reference(and then actual corn).

Spacebar/X shoots.  Arrow keys move.

You're Snake Plissken, surfing to escape from various locales!  Shoot floating barrels to drop them on enemies below or dodge them and hope they wipe out the foes behind you.

If you want, you can skip to any of the 4 levels by pressing that number while in game.  The final stage ramps up in difficulty rather steeply, but I didn't put in a victory screen for winning so you're not missing anything if you don't beat it, except glory.

entries.title: The Cell
entries.description:
The game uses Java, you need that installed to run. It's available as an applet (though Java applets on OSX arn't nice) and as a downloadable game. 

You are Sidney, a convict wrongly banged up. Sidney has mutant powers - the ability to copy himself. Sidney must escape through a series of cells to be free of the prison.

Avoid the prison guards, they'll wake up if you get to close. Avoid traps and lazers. Press the switches to open the doors to the cells.

entries.title: The Escape of the White Square
entries.description:
Controls: WASD or Arrows keys to move

My first Ludum Dare Entry, I've tested it on Chrome and Safari.

Thanks for playing,
Geroro.

Edit: I fixed the problem for Firefox, but it was after the initial 48 hours so I'm including it as a second link (is this ok to do?).

Thanks for all the feedback so far

entries.title: You've got the money: Escape
entries.description: Made in Unity by @tompritcharduk

entries.title: Asplosions!
entries.description: Yay! My first Ludum Dare entry. No sound or music though, not enough time :(. You are escaping from... something along the lines of bloodthirsty sumo-wrestlers and soldiers. I had other ideas and level designs, so i guess i will make a post-LD version. Hope you enjoy!

entries.title: AWOL
entries.description:
I decided to do this last minute so kept it kind of secret. Didn't tweet or update, just got my head down and made it!

The story goes something like this : 
You are a convict in an off world prison facility. A moment to escape rears its head, and you take it. Grabbing the nearby vehicle carelessly left unattended at the gate you make a run for it. Get as far away as you can from the prison before your inevitble capture.

Tools used : 
Unity 3.4 Pro
VS 2010
Modo501
Cubase 4

Libraries used :
iTween
JCar

entries.title: Blockhead Can't Escape
entries.description: When you finish level 4, you'll be returned to the first level. There is no escape.

entries.title: Cyperspace...
entries.description:
For some reason, you are in cyperspace. And things want you dead - get out fast. The faster the better, and mind that data!

RACE ON - Moving is just as hard as memory management. In ASM8086 ahaha... You'll see.

In empty-space - there are no gravities.
In cyber-space - there are no environmental physics.
In space - no one can hear you go WTF IS THIIISSS???? (A great movie)

Controls:  Arrow keys.
Bugs 96, 27, 110, 110 and 111 are still present resulting in weird behaviour when using the '`' key, 'esc' key, level lodaing, death / winning and audio respectively...

entries.title: Dude Running From an Explosion
entries.description:
http://jakexyz.com/ld21/

Everything is at the site. If it doesn't work on a non-Windows computer, I'll try switching up the natives!

Resources Used:

LWJGL
Slick
sfxr

entries.title: Escape from Limbo
entries.description:
The game was made in RPG Maker VX due to the basecode I was making for the compo not being ready.

Your mission is to escape limbo, average playtime is ~5-10 minutes.

The game is terrible due to my lack of being able to not take 3-4 hours to do one tile >.>

Please donate to a poor student

entries.title: Escape From Poorhood
entries.description: You are poor. So you beg for other people's money. You can gamble also. Help your mother become rich.

entries.title: Faceless
entries.description:
You are in jail.

Try to escape.

Press A to use your face.



- game by DragonSix
- http://twitter.com/Drag0nSix



Additionnal notes :
-It's an XNA game, so I've put the necessary installers in the zip file if you need it.
-The game should be not performance hungry at all, but for those with very very weak configs, the game could act strange when under 20 fps. Sorry about that.

entries.title: Flight of the Teddy Bear
entries.description:
Guide the teddy bear to the exit of each level. Watch out for the nasty orange bears! Stay in their sight too long and they'll shoot you! (With invisible guns.)

Created mostly under compo rules, except I decided to finish after the deadline instead of pulling an all-nighter on a work night (Sunday). :)

entries.title: Free Bee
entries.description:
Use your mouse to grab a cube of sugar and guide all the bees out through the nearest exit. But be quick ... time's running out!

Tools used: HTML5 canvas + JavaScript, Inkscape, Komodo Edit, Professor Cloud's SVG converter, Chrome and Firefox all running on Arch Linux. Background photos taken in the garden and converted using the GIMP editor.

Please see comments in source for additional credits. The game design, code and art were created on my own.

Looking forward to your feedback, suggestions and forks! Did you manage to complete the game? Get at least 500 points? Too easy, hard, any other issues? Let me know in the comments below.

entries.title: Get Away
entries.description:
This is a game where you have to evade the police in your get-away car as you race across the desert. Well, that's what it is supposed to be anyway. This was my first LD48 and it was quite the learning experience. I used Java with the Slick2D engine, which I had never used before. I didn't get it finished, but I am happy I got something.

Controls:Arrow keys for steering and gas/brake

The arrow at the top points to the target.

Avoid police cars and cacti.

entries.title: Grappling-Hook Jones
entries.description:
Sadly I ran into some technical problems right when I thought it was finished. I didn't have time to fix them. There is a chance it might lag horribly for no reason. I hope this doesn't affect too many PCs.

Run it by double-clicking run.bat

entries.title: I am Ourobouros
entries.description:
This is my first game ever.
It includes the first three themes of the compo : Escape, Self-replication and Adaptation.
I'm not a native english speaker, so, I suppose there are plenty of english mistakes. Sorry. 
It should be playable on Mac with Boot Camp.
Left click to walk and interact. You also can use arrows keys to walk.
[Edit 22/08 : There are two ending (Fail/Win).

The game was made with Adventure Game Studio with the "KeyboardMovement" module, GraphicsGale and Audacity.

entries.title: Magiscape
entries.description:
Use right click to go to this point.
Use left click to shoot a fire ball. Mind that there is "reload time" so you will not be able to shoot fast.

Edit: Update to properly handle mouse clicks!

entries.title: Number 23 Escapes!
entries.description:
Wow. I literally just wrote code, 3d-modelled, composed music pretty much non-stop for 48 hours. I had some problems building the Windows version in the end, so posting this a little late (thank god for the extension!).

The game is a little smaller than I originally planned, but I'm pretty proud of it and I hope that you enjoy it!

I used a framework called Polycode (which I am also the developer of and which you can find at polycode.org). 

Aside from that I used Blender for 3d modelling and animation, Photoshop for  all graphical needs, Reason 4 for music and SFXR for sounds.

The code is a real mess, so don't take it too seriously. I had to jam a ton of quick fixes in the last few hours, so it's really really ugly.

HOPE YOU LIKE IT!!

entries.title: Perdiganawe
entries.description:
You're the amazing Perdigod, and must guide your people, the Perdiganawe tribe, to safety, before the raining season begins .
Why's the raining season so dangerous? well... it rains comets. 

In order to escape certain death, every year the Perdiganawe must have a ritualistic peregrination to the Nose Totem, wich will protect them from the mighty rain. 

Objectives : 

- Get to a safe point with the minimum amount of Perdiganawes to finish the mission.
- If the Apocalipse bar is depleted ( top-most of the screen ) , the rain begins. you still have a chance to get to the end, but watch out for the comets! 

Tips :

- Lots of things can be dangerous, even Bridges!
- Never get too close to the predator.
- Sometimes you just have to face dangers instead of avoiding them.


Controls : 

In a Warcraft / Starcraft Style control, you may select your units by clicking and dragging a selection box over them.
Once selected, Right-Click will make them go to the appointed location.

Arrow Keys move the camera.


That's it! hope you enjoy!! 


* The thiers brothers *

entries.title: Poor Ball
entries.description:
Poor Ball is the story of a little girl with dark thoughts, Ball, who tries to put an end to her suffering... It's a game where you have to be reactive and prevent Ball, a small ball, from leaving her house. Ball runs faster and faster and you have to place obstacles which she will bounce off.

Language: C++
Libraries: SFML2, FMOD

entries.title: Prison Planet Trench Escape
entries.description:
Prison Planet Trench Escape!  Escape from the prison planet in a stolen ship while in hot persuit by the bladed THRESHER, the end of many would-be escapees.  Avoid obstacles and shots from defense drones.  Only the Thresher can destroy your craft, but any hits you take will slow you down.  The game is a vertical scrolling game played with the arrow keys or WASD.

Engine: Unity3D
Programming: C#
Modeling: Blender
Art/Textures: Paint.Net, Photoshop
Sound: Audacity, Bfxr
Music: Audacity, Otomata, (ClubCreate) Electro-House Blender

The game meets most all of the requirements for the main competition, but is entered into the Jam because I wanted to work with a partner.  Actually, I'm not entirely sure if mixing software like the electro-house blender is specifically allowed by the rules.  I think it is since the loops are legally usable, but I dunno!

Credits: 
Programming: Dan 'Doddler' McNeill
Art: Mike Paulson

entries.title: Profit
entries.description:
Try to save your and your colleagues monday morning by getting some refreshin coffee! Try to avoid producers and make sure you get lots of coffee! Arrow keys to move your character.

Needs XNA 4 runtime installed.

Check out a video of this game if you can't play it!

entries.title: Roundman: Escape from Squareworld
entries.description: RUN! RUN FROM THE VOID! ESCAPE SQUAREWORLD! GO!

entries.title: Ruin Runner
entries.description:
Ruin Runner

This game is about escaping ruins. There are a lot of obstacles, but you can jump over them, or walk over them with the shield or without the shield.

Controls:
ENTER - Start level
UP - Jump
RIGHT - Go forward
LEFT - Go back
Q, W, E, R - Shields

It's our first jam game and we haven't got enough time to complete it, so it has some bugs. It was written in Ubuntu 10.10, C and SDL.

In case, you want to run it on Linux, you will have to have packages: libsdl, libsdl_image and libsdl_ttf.

We hope, you'll enjoy it. Team InfinityLeaks.

entries.title: Space Pirates Suck!
entries.description:
Would like to make another level or two, it's a bit short. But here is as it stands at the 48 hour mark.

The more quickly you move, the more readily you'll be detected, so sneak if you plan on coming from behind.

edit: another note, the enemies' vision cones is primarily an indicator of their facing direction, not the range at which they can see you. They can see much further than that.

entries.title: Where am I?
entries.description: Running while being shot from behind, collecting green squares and not knowing where you're going.

entries.title: 26 Prisoners
entries.description:
Prisoners of a war of words, many women and men of letters need a guiding hand to escape from camps of genuine, physical terrors. Not every prisoner can be saved... you'll just have to try your best.

CONTROLS (game doesn't mention all of them, thanks Tulrath for reminding me of this in the comments): Letter keys to select and deselect prisoners. Backspace to deselect all prisoners. Space to pause. Click to move prisoners around (Ctrl-click to deselect them after click). Arrow keys to move camera around on the couple of levels this is required, or move mouse to the edge of the screen.

Game is a Flash .swf, so will probably run in your browser. Thanks ChevyRay for FlashPunk, a pleasant and powerful framework for a little game like this. Apologies to fans of good pathfinding - you won't find any of that here.

entries.title: Ceaseless
entries.description:
Escape is unrelenting. To truly accomplish this task, you must ceaselessly, tirelessly run.

(Instructions included in the linked page.)

entries.title: Dare To Escape
entries.description:
****I FIXED SOME IMPORTANT BUG THAT PREVENTS THE GAME FROM STARTING****
As a result of this I had to remove all audio, so the files are significantly smaller than before. If you still get problems please say so in comments. Since I can only have 5 links I removed the HiDef download link of the old build.
You can still download it here: Windows - HiDef http://www.mediafire.com/?hybb4pjxib9wpxs

Dare To Escape is a bullet-hell platformer.

You need XNA/.NET 4 to play the game.
I am sorry for this! Never had to distribute an XNA game before. Thought they would work out of the box.

It's my first time participating in LD and the first "serious" game I did by myself.

Sadly there is not much content due to huge time problems.
In exchange the difficulty curve is insane in the two levels it has.

If the HiDef-version doesnt work for you, try out the Reach-version! If the Reach version doesn't work pls specify the error you get.

I didn't include the uncompressed audio files in the source as they take 300mb of space. If you want to compile it you have to remove all occurences where the AudioManager or AudioHelper is used.

The music was generated using http://tones.wolfram.com/generate/ . I hope this is allowed seeing how programs such as bfxr are allowed to generate sound effects.

There is currently a bug in that bosses sometimes dont spawn if you play the game in one session. If you find a blue orb without there being a boss you should restart the game. You can use the resume feature afterwards to start at your last checkpoint and the boss should be there this time (if you didnt save after picking up the blue orb).

I might expand upon this game in the future. If you're interested to see more content and better mechanics etc. feel free to visit my blog: http://projectblackdragon.blogspot.com/

entries.title: Death Game
entries.description:
This is my entry for the LD #21 and my first game as well. I hope you like it.

Here you play a game from the death, it calls you and others souls to take a chance to come back to life and escapes from the death domains.

Use WASD to control, Mouse to shoot and E to create your own path until the exit. Only one soul can get it's life back, will it be you?

I doubt... huuhuh

entries.title: Escape at Faermort
entries.description:
Your country is under enemy invasion, and the only option to launch the successful counter-offensive is to first save your President. You are the pilot of Freedom 01, the ultra-tech powered special aircraft of the President.

Can you escort him to safety across the fortuitous Faermort Sea?

Team:
Yadu Rajiv - Engine and Level Programming
Nandeep Mal - AI
Kinshuk Sunil - Sound & Music
Ravish Malik - Art

entries.title: Escape Deletion
entries.description:
I have written a short post mortem on the whole thing.
http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2011/08/22/escape-deletion-post-mortem/

My start and end screens were unfinished, so directions are - use the arrow keys to move, esc to exit from the game, spacebar after you die. Don't touch anything. Don't let anything touch you. Get to the end of each level.

-- Fixed the missing libraries. Back to ruby 1.9.2. Going to move the source up to github today-ish.

-- Uploaded Mac version

-- Uploaded source code

entries.title: Escape from Dr. Evilface's Maze
entries.description:
Quite simple, you are the world renound super-spy, Derick. And you need to escape from a maze set up by Dr. Evilface. Sounds easy on paper, huh? IF IT NOT FOR THE RABID SHEEP!!!

Side Note: Chrome seems to be have some problems running the game

entries.title: Escape from Shimishland
entries.description: Escape from Shimishland! (Instructions in Game)

entries.title: Escape from Strong Castle
entries.description: In most RPGs, you are encouraged to fight every enemy, but in this one, you are encouraged to run away instead! Guide Scrawny, an untrained treasure hunter, out of Strong Castle while running away frrom the monsters surrounding this 20-floor stronghold.

entries.title: Escape from the Tower
entries.description: Tested in chrome only. Incomplete, no damage from spikes, no enemies, and only only 3 partial levels :(

entries.title: Escape Velocity
entries.description: Instructions: WASD controls your velocity, but you have limited control due to the gravitational pull of the black hole you are closely orbiting. Use the mouse to shoot and kill 200 enemies!

entries.title: Escape Velocity
entries.description:
You're an indentured pilot, working for EscaCorp interstellar delivery company. 

Your father was also a pilot but he crashed the company's ship, leaving you with his debt.

Your boss gives you so little fuel for each trip, you're lucky not to slam into a planet or be lost careening into deep space! You have no choice though; you're just a few deliveries away from earning your freedom!

You have to use the gravity of stars and planets to slingshot your way to the delivery zone!


Use the arrow keys to accelerate but watch your fuel! (METER ON THE LEFT)
F5 resets the game. I said F5 RESETS THE GAME!
Pause pauses :)

Note: The delivery zone is always to your right somewhere.

Thanks for playing! :)

By the way, this is my first Ludum Dare entry. I really appreciate every comment that lets me know someone has played it and REALLY appreciate the great feedback I've been getting!

Post-compo EDITS: 
I now have 3 executables in my .zip. See readme.txt and take your pick! Extra-crispy is the latest and greatest and by far the tastiest but is VERY post-compo [latest is v1.2].

New Features Added:
Multiple ships (extra lives).
Menu with multiple difficulties.
Target zone indicator.
Animation and more.

The compo executable is there too (EV_Gross_Compo.exe) and none of it's original assets have been fiddled with.

I now have a linux executable and source! THANKS JohanAR!

entries.title: EscapeOut
entries.description:
Made in FlashDevelop with Flixel. It's your average Breakout clone. Or is it?

This is not only my first ever Ludum Dare entry, but also my first game coded from scratch. I've previously used Stencyl to develop game prototypes. EscapeOut itself is more prototype than game: given time, I could improve it by adding sounds, a timer, powerups, and better visual cues. Still, I'm very proud of what I've produced. I hope you enjoy.

entries.title: Evasion
entries.description:
Made in Java, should work on most machines. A classic game of "escape the guards, turn off the lights, run along corridors". The lighting engine is *very dirty* and works only because it rounds off floats in a weird way. Most of the time was spent on that, sadly...

Music made in 5 minutes in Ableton Live, sound effects voiced by yours truly.

Tested on linux/mac os, should work on Windows.

(EDIT: I made a complete package of the whole game in a single jar that should work if you have Java installed and if the previous package did not work)

(EDIT2: I know you need to download to play, but the game has to be seen while moving, the screenshot cannot show the greatest part of the game. So if you needed just a little bit more incentive to actually try to play the game, here it is ;) Thanks in advance!)

entries.title: Keep Running
entries.description: The sirens go off. There's been another jail break and they want you to find and kill the prisoners. You've done this countless times before but you're conscious can't ignore this anymore. You can't do it, you want to escape this life. So you decide to aid the prisoners in their struggle for freedom. Your job is to provide covering fire for the prisoners.

entries.title: Light Maze
entries.description:
Simple maze game with a twist : you have to turn off the lights to go through colored walls ... and to turn them back on to walk on colored floor !
If a level's too hard, just hit ESCAPE.
Apologies for programmer graphics.
Made with : FlashDevelop (code), Flash CS4 (some assets), sfxr (crappy sound effects).

entries.title: Lost in the Depths
entries.description:
Lost in the Depths is a multiplayer roguelike where you play as an adventurer who must escape the dungeon after things go awry.

Note that while this game supports multiple players on the server, it is still winnable with only one player.

Controls:
1-9 - Activate ability on target near cursor
Numeric Keypad - Move one space
Mouse click - Move
H - Help screen
C - Carve on floor
I - View inventory
P - Pick up item(s) on ground
Enter - Chat local
G - Chat global

The web link goes to an applet which should automatically connect to the server. However, it may fail for some reason. If this happens, you will get a black screen after pressing "Connect". If that happens:
- Check that TCP port 17998 is open outbound if you have a firewall
- Close your browser, wait one minute, and then open the link again. This may be able to correct an issue with the Java plugin

entries.title: Lost In the Shadows
entries.description:
The game is a rogue like adventure game where a dwarf is lost in the mines and tries to escape without dying. You have to find the exit, dig for water to survive and collect as much gold nuggets as possible on the way.

gameplay tips: 
- if water is near you will hear it.
- the harder rocks inherit more water and nuggets
- the exit can be anywhere not just in a room

Its my first LD and  I am satisfied with the result in terms of what I have got done in the time. Even though the gameplay could be more fun.. ;) 

Use WASD or cursor keys. Sound is necessary for the full game experience.

entries.title: Mass Escape
entries.description:
Pick up all the prisoners and let them escape!
Move with arrow keys.

entries.title: Momentum
entries.description:
Do your best to escape the darkness in Momentum.

**Note on Controls:**

The controls are gravity based.  You don't move the ball, you change the gravity. So if you hit up, you only change the gravity to pull the ball up; if you hit down, you change the gravity to pull the ball down.

The key to movement is to time the key hits so that the combination of gravity (up, down, left, right) moves the ball the way you want.  once you get the hang of it, we found it to be quite fun.

entries.title: Mountain above the clouds
entries.description:
LD21 - Escape : Mountain above the clouds

*** Story ***

The legends say that each year, and for 3 minutes only, the great mountain above the clouds opens it's mouth to breath new life onto the world.

Today is that day.

You play the role of a magical seed that is buried inside the giant mountain. Your task is to escape from the mountain's belly and into the sky, before it closes its mouth again.


*** Controls ***

This game uses the mouse only. Click on the screen to cause the seed to fly. 
When the mouse button is pressed, the seed will fly towards the cursor.


*** Other ***

- Flying near to the walls and ground will often cause new plants to grow,which in turn release more spores. 
- For additional challenge, collect as many of the spores as you can before leaving the mountain. 
-Then try collecting them all in as short a time as possible.
-this submission has no sound. Sorry :(


I hope you enjoy playing.
Any comments and criticisms welcome!




[source link fixed]

entries.title: Stormcrow
entries.description: Escape the trigger happy galactic police in your shiny new stolen space ship prototype.

entries.title: The Bachelor's Escape
entries.description:
Playigitx is proud to present The Bachelor's Escape!

John McPlayer has risen to fame and fortune. Will he be able to escape from the clutches of all girls worldwide?

Arrows (or W/A/D) to move.
Space to use ugliness potions, for a brief relief.
While ugliness is in effect, you are kind of evil, so you may steal girls' money.

IT MAKES SENSE, TRUST ME.

Have fun!

Bugs:
- Sometimes (rarely) the game freezes. Sorry.

entries.title: Abscond
entries.description:
Hi! This is my first Ludum Dare entry. I'm pretty happy with how it turned out. In Abscond, you play as a serf who must feed his family and pay his lord. You're unhappy. You must construct a boat to escape from the island.

Your ending will be different based on how you complete the game.

Controls and further details are included in the game. Don't forget to vote!

Tools used:
FlashDevelop
Bitbucket/Mercurial
Paint.NET
inudge
bfxr
Audacity

Libraries used:
Flixel

Contact/follow me at:
http://harrism.com

entries.title: Alien Break
entries.description:
You play as an alien life form who was captured by some humans, and you must escape. The game is really short, but it might take awhile if you are not used to playing these kind of games.
Escape the bullets!

entries.title: and just like that
entries.description:
Built in flixel + tiled + garageband + flashdevelop + photoshop.  I wanted to build something that tries to explain why I would spend 48 hours writing script and making crude pixels, why I would quit my steady job making AAA games to make small things that are given away for free, why if something is too good to be true, you should run from it, because it's fake.



UPDATE: due to popular demand from some people on my google plus, in the next day or two I will be releasing a Director's Cut version of this game that has all the levels (approx 8 more) that I had to cut because they were either too hard or unfinished (once I finish them).  This version will also have a timer running (with a leaderboard for those what complete it), and each death will add some amount of time.  Oh and when I release it I'll unlock all the secret rooms, too :)  I'll post on the frontpage when this happens, as well as a post-mortem shortly after that.

UPDATE: Post Mortem posted:   http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2011/08/23/and-just-like-that-a-post-mortem/

entries.title: Another Escape From Self Replicating Bugs 2
entries.description:
This game will need internet-access for the full FUN! :-)
It will load the locations of the deaths of other players into your map!

You are a robot-scientist who is attacked by bugs in his lab.

You have a LASER weapon to defend yourself!

The number below the stairs indicate how many people went in there. (Not how many died there)


--- Want to know how i've done that? See here: 
http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/?p=68738

entries.title: Block escape
entries.description:
The craft is in the middle of a 1000x1000 matrix of blocks. The objective is to escape the matrix. Move with the arrowkeys, space shoots. The white blocks are indestructible.

Escape quits to menu, in the menu escape quits the game. Pressing escape in the game will DESTROY your current progress. 

The movement is "newtonian", like in asteroids.

entries.title: Captive
entries.description:
Captive


Captive is a game created in Blitz3D (www.blitzbasic.com) for the competition Ludum Dare 21.

It was created by Martin Cooke on behalf of Drytree Studios. I worked solo, created all my assets in 48 hours, and have included source.

Enjoy :)

entries.title: Castle Skate
entries.description:
A one-button-game (escape), try to escape the evil viking for as long as you can. But be aware of the traps in the castle!

It seems that the distance indicator doesnt work well in chrome for some reason.

entries.title: Daring Do!
entries.description:
My first Ludum Dare! I changed my game idea on the 2nd day of Ludum Dare, so I had to throw this together in just over a day! My main gripe is the terrible main character sprite, but I just ran out of time to fix it. The difficulty ramps up fairly quickly after the first level, too.

In the future, I'm planning to add way more levels, crumbly blocks that fall away beneath you (or on you!), spikes, perhaps bad guys, more treasure to collect, scores, and ideally an 'infinite' mode that generates infinitely long levels on the fly. For now, though, you'll have to put up with this 3 level taster.

entries.title: Epic Escape
entries.description: My first LD attempt! Thanks for checking it out!

entries.title: Escape of the AMAZING TRIANGLE
entries.description:
Hi All,

This is my entry to LD21. Currently Windows only.

Your goal is to get the little triangle to the exit at each level - ESCAPING from where ever it is.
Lay a path with the mouse, and press SPACE to follow it! You can lay more than one path, but the number of nodes is limited.
Beware of the rotating lasers!

Hope you like it! :-)

Written with Visual C++ using ClanLib and OpenGL.
Graphics are mostly hard coded, title and ending in Paint.net.
Music in Fruityloops and sound effects in sfxr.

YAY!

Daniel

entries.title: Escape Paradise
entries.description:
This is my first LD ever, and while the game isn't anything worthy of too much praise, I had a great experience and learnt a lot for the next one.

Lessons:
1. Study up on tech BEFORE the compo starts. I spent a good chunk of time doing FlashPunk tutorials and things just to get my game going and it wasn't until Sunday where things really pulled together.
2. Keep it simple. I over-scoped bigtime on my game here and had to hack together gameplay at the very end. There is so much I wanted to do, but just no time.
3. Learn how to make music. I can do the art, coding, and effects just fine, but I am hopeless with music. For the next one!

Software:
FlashDevelop IDE
FlashPunk library (thanks Chevy!)
Photoshop
Ogmo level editor

Send any feedback you have to @bkavs or the e-mail on my website at www.kavs.ca. 

Thanks!

EDIT: Some players are getting stuck inside collision when they change zones too close to a wall or water tile. It's rare, but try and 'zone' at least half a tile away from collidables. Also, it sometimes goes funky if you change zones too much (primarily around 1-1 and 1-2). Sorry. :(

entries.title: Escape the Drones
entries.description:
First time touching unity. Turned out fairly well. Added decent audio this time. Left out music as it seemed to cover up the audio cues of the player being detected. The heightmap was made in geocontrol 2 and then I threw together some textures for it.

When playing try to use the terrain to your advantage. Running like mad usually ends up with the player getting exploded off the map.(Weeee!)

The terrain is a bit over 16 square km. All of the artwork and sounds including the particle sprites were done by me this weekend. I didnt use a single premade unity item.

Tools used:
3d studio max
photoshop
unity
geocontrol2
notepad++

I havent tested the mac version but if it doesen't work give the web version a try (it is an offline html.)

Update: few hours left. Increased the "Oh Sh!t" factor a bit.
Unity has a undocumented feature where it culls a bunch of stuff when you change the FOV of a camera. Zooming will lag a lot but it is still good to use if you are not getting shot at.

entries.title: Facebreak Escape
entries.description:
Facebreak Escape is a game where prisoners are trying to escape a dungeon. You have to escape the prison by fighting against hordes of security guards with your allies and reach the freedom which lies ahead.

To reach the end you have to brawl with 11 waves of enemies, collect loafs of break to gain health and free your friends from cages haning from the roof.

You can move using arrows and pressing up your character will jump, use X to punch enemies and cages.

Hope you enjoy the game!

entries.title: Help!  I'm trapped in a compact 2D Riemannian manifold!
entries.description:
Written from scratch over the last 72 hours.  The story:

"A wizard has trapped you in a piece of non-Euclidean geometry!  Use the mouse to roll past dangerous hazards to escape the confines of your warped prison!"


Controls: Arrow keys navigate menus, mouse moves the ball around

Tools used: Linux, g++, GNU Make, OpenGL, GLFW, Eigen, SDLAudio and a bunch of calculus

Authors: Mikola Lysenko, Matt Watkins

Thanks to Wallacoloo for help with the windows port!

entries.title: I was  a teenage Hipster!
entries.description:
Follow Trevor, the lead singer of Hedge Social, as he makes his way through a hipster's worst nightmare - vintage clothing shops, coffee parlors, used record stores have all closed forever! Oh and there's a zombie apocalypse too, but the coffee parlors!!

[FOR WINDOWS USERS: just download the zip, and run escape.exe]

entries.title: It Burns!
entries.description:
A pretty standard platformer about a vampire whose home has been invaded by a floating orb of light. Get to the bottom of the disturbance so you can finally get some sleep.. and goodness don't we all need sleep after Ludum Dare?

Source is the .cap file (Construct Classic) in the zip.

Requires:
 DirectX 9c. (Even if you have DirectX 11.)
 Pixel Shader 2.0

entries.title: On The Run!
entries.description:
NEW: Linux support with curses! (Do note that it requires a very large terminal window; you may have to mess with your prompt to get it to fit)

The story is described in-game, but in short: You are an AI in a Shadowrun-style futuristic setting, trying to evade those who wish you destroyed.

Written in Python using only the stdlib and WConio.
Purely console based, Windows-only.

I was extremely happy with how the UI turned out - it captured that Movie Interface feel quite nicely. Much of the gameplay itself was coded in under 12 hours, and there's so much more I wish I could do, but I'm satisfied enough.

You can view a screenshot progress archive at https://github.com/jtruscott/ld21/tree/master/snapshots

Notes:
- Please use the Windows Binary (Fixed) link! 
The original submission would get completely wedged if you got purged from a node.

- Typing long command names can get tedious. However, once you've disambiguated a name to only have only matching command, it'll happily run it. For example, 'neighbors' can thus be shortened all the way down to 'n'.


Happy hacking!

- Spigot [Rectifier on IRC]

entries.title: Slimes!
entries.description:
Help a swarm of blobby slimes ESCAPE from the death factory! 

Split them apart, join them back together! Jump! Dodge! Die! Infinite fun!


*Update!*
Uploaded a new version, only change being that it's compiled for the 'reach' XNA profile, which allow it to work on most every system. Should have done that before I even started!


Built from the ground up with C#, XNA, and the Farseer Physics Engine. 

You'll need the XNA 4.0 Redistributable, you can grab it here: http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=20914

This is my first compo, wow what a blast! I am well and truly drained. Lots of fun, though!

Let me know what you think! 

- Joe 
[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */

entries.title: Soul Hellscape
entries.description:
Hi all, this is my first LD entry, hope you like it.

In this sandboxy game you help trapped souls by placing your "Holy Light" beam that attracts them and lets you guide them to the Gate of Hell, where they can escape. All while several types of baddies attempt to nibble on the delicious, innocent souls. You can zap them with a "Divine Lightning". Plus a few more fancy features.

Software: VS (C# + XNA), Photoshop, Maya, sfxr
Requires: Windows, .NET, XNA, mouse/keyboard

XNA 4.0 redist: http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=20914
.NET 4 redist: http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=24872

entries.title: The Life of Borgy
entries.description:
Not really finished, since there were a few physics problems ( still there). 
It doesn't run on some computers for some reason... and on some computers, you have to press 1 in the main menu to get to the second level. 

For Windows users: just unpack the zip file and start the exe.

For everyone else: install Love2D (http://www.love2d.org) and run the .love file.

Connection to escape: you should escape the facility through various rooms with a meaningful ending (sadly I didn't get around to finishing the ending, so much for that. 

The source is included in the .love file, which can be unpacked as .zip archive with 7-zip ( or other archive tools)

entries.title: The Sky Is Falling
entries.description:
THE SKY IS FALLING
Philip Buchanan

The Sky Is Falling, and you need to find refuge to escape from the chaos. Leap across the remanants of the world (using the arrow keys) and make it to saftey. This entire game was written in the final 13 hours of the competition. It took half the time of my previous entries, and works better than all of them combined.

Run the executable in the system directory.

It's only going to compile for Windows. Sorry!

Edit: Once you start falling, you'll need to quit and restart the game to try again.

Edit2: To save your sanity, I've now included a version that has a reset button ('R'). Everything else is unchanged, and the original is still there for you to play too.

entries.title: We'd like it if you Stay
entries.description:
You must escape from this place

This is a puzzle game. I think it's best if I don't say any more!


Controls:
WSAD/Arrow keys: Move character
Left mouse button: grab and hold the yellow-ish blocks
m: mute sound
r: restart level (this is probably needed on one level)

And only if you are really stumped:
-: previous level
=: next level

Tools used:
Unity (indie version)
Blender
BFXR (http://www.bfxr.net/)
Photoshop
Audacity (to loop a sound from bfxr, this was probably useless as I can do that in unity too)

Warning: I have no idea if the mac version works as I do not have a machine to test it on... Please let me know how it goes.

entries.title: When I Was Human
entries.description:
They've been experimenting on you! You feel...strange.
Evil Government(tm); are trying to wipe you off the face of the earth. You need to escape!
Get your blood pumping, the adrenaline might unlock your sinister new potential....

entries.title: Abandoned
entries.description: Move with arrow keys, attack with Ctrl. Unleash special attack with the ESC-key, but beware: they are limited and can only be refilled through white chrystals. Can you escape this wicked world?

entries.title: About Julie's Escape
entries.description:
You are Julie, last survivor of mankind and this is your story: About Julie's Escape. 

Gameplay video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_XHvb5kUMaE

Your main goal is always to reach the escape point shown by a golden goblet, which is located in the corner diagonally to your starting corner. Beware! There are monsters creeping around! Do not touch them or they will hurt you, which leads to death after some time. The hearts at the top of the screen are showing your healthness.

entries.title: Action Monkey
entries.description:
My first XNA game. There's an installer version at http://mattmakesgames.com/games/ActionMonkeyInstall.zip if this doesn't work for you.

Gameplay Video:  http://vimeo.com/28020677

=======================================================

PLEASE use a gamepad!!! XBox 360 controllers will work natively, but I included JoyToKey for other gamepads.

Press F4 at the title screen to toggle screen mode!

=======================================================

TIPS:
-You can cling to walls AND ceilings!

-While clinging, move to a corner, you'll climb around it!

-Try jumping from a wall cling!

-Try ducking then jumping!

-Stay above the pink line or collect coins to fill your multiplier bar!

-Every time your multiplier bar fills up, you get more points for the time you survive!

entries.title: Arachnid Escape
entries.description: Aim with the mouse, and fire up to to webs with space and left mouse button.

entries.title: Ball Escape
entries.description:
I'm new to this so my only goal was to have SOMETHING that could technically be called a game by the end. As a result there is no art, no instructions and some important info that should be on screen on each level is not :). However I spent a lot of time on this and will upload it anyway.

Move the Big Green Dot (BGD) from where it starts to the hole in the side of the window without touching one of the moving red dots on the way. You can do this by either left clicking to create a point that the BGD will move towards if it can, or right clicking to create a point the BGD will move away from whenever it can. You have a limited number of each points which varies from level to level. Middle clicking on a point removes it.

entries.title: Captain Starfire's Great Escape!
entries.description:
This is my first ever Ludum Dare compo entry, and my first real game of its type using the Java language. 
You'll need Java installed to run it. 

It's a wave-based stationary survival game, with the goal to move through waves of enemies by shooting at them.
Note: The story (detailed in game intro screens + death screen + win screens) is the important part of the theme integration.

::-- You must survive 20 waves to escape the onslaught --::

-----------------------------------------------------------

IMPORTANT: 

I've seen the comments about the playability and bugs, so here's some warnings/tips before playing: 

1. Due to the way it's coded, bullets are only destroyed when they exit the screen or hit an enemy. Firing loads of bullets can lag the game. Fire in single or double bursts for best gameplay - as few bullets as possible at a time.
 
2. Bullets have faster speeds when you fire with the cursor more towards the edge of the game field - to avoid the bullet clean-up problem mentioned in number (1), try to fire as far out as possible (again, in single or double bursts).

3. Also due to the coding, only the most recent bullet fired will have collision. This can cause problems in clean-up (for example creating a bullet shield at slow speed means those bullets will not be cleaned up as they will not get to the edge of the screen or hit an enemy) and may confuse gameplay. For the best advice, I'd say that sticking to single or double shots will help in all cases (again). 

TL;DR:

Fire as few bullets as possible, aiming as close to the edge of the screen (or the enemy you wish to kill) as possible, to get best performance and (hopefully) enjoyment. 

-----------------------------------------------------------

Please do feed back. It's a .jar file so feel free to download whichever "platform" you like. 

I hope you enjoy the game. 

- Jonno

entries.title: epacse
entries.description:
epacse - an alternative physics platformer.

Controls not explained in the game:
F - toggle FPS display
Esc - exit the game instantly
Edit "SCREEN_ZOOM" variable in settings.conf to make the game window bigger or smaller.

The game doesn't save your progress, but it takes 20-30 minutes to beat. It's almost impossible to accidentally get stuck, so keep experimenting!
There's also a hidden SECRET ENDING to discover!

System requirements:
About every modern PC will be able to run epacse. Braid would be a good measure. On Linux, you'll need SDL, FMOD (fmodex) and zlib.

Compatibility issues:
epacse has problems running on Legacy Radeon drivers on Windows. It works fine on Linux with the same hardware.

Development:
epacse is written in pure C, using SDL, OpenGL, SOIL and FMOD. The game was built on my basic, incomplete, opensource engine. It was tweaked, modified and expanded heavily during LD.
All the graphics and levels were made in GIMP, sounds in bfxr.

Thanks:
Randati - for testing and support!
kosinus, mcc - for Mac ports
#ludumdare - for laughs
You - for playing!

Have fun!

The scary house part was done using the following:
-Music: Mi chord on my crappy and broken guitar, recorded using Windows Sound Recorder
-Sound effects: Random noises recorded and distorted on windows sound recorders
-Graphics: My Nokia N8 Camera, with some messing in the light sensivity settings, all the pictures are from my house.
-Coding: Everything done in processing.

entries.title: MageRunner
entries.description:
You were once a powerful wizard who dedicated your life to fighting evil.
Yet your power could not match that of the MazeMaster, who banished you to his personal realm of mystery. If you can escape through all 50 floors of the Labyrinth the realm will collapse, and the MazeMaster's power will be destroyed.
It won't be easy, especially when death is final...

==============================
Features
==============================
*50 Floor labyrinth that must be cleared by one character.

* Full RPG progression system: levels, skill points, elemental attack/defence, speed.

* Permadeath: that's right. Make sure to stock up on potions if you want to survive, and you'll have to manage them well!

* All battles are automated, but you get to watch!

* Single world for all players: if we are online and "nearby" I can throw my items on the ground for you!

* New Game +: If (by some magic) you complete all 50 floors,  you can restart with a new character and enemies will have 2x health. Do this again for 3x, 4x etc: THERE'S NO STOPPING THE FUN!

* Secret and visible items litter the labyrinth for harvesting: you aren't just looking for the stairs all the time!

entries.title: Siren's Wail
entries.description:
(this paragraph relates to 8/21/11) I was only aware of this particular dare about 18 hours ago, if that. I started working on it at about noon, with some barebones things done in the morning. I personally found it fun to make, although I assure my next submissions will have more time spent on them.

So pretty much, your city's about to be nuked or something of the sorts, and logically it'd be best suited to high-tail it out of there. Of course, nothing's stopping you from grabbing some loot along the way - call it reparations, cash it in for your troubles. A non-linear goal of simply "get outside the city" and plenty of different ways to interact with the game world allow for all sorts of different solutions, not just one. For example, you can:

-Drive a tank through a strip-mall
-Assassinate a general and raid his military base
-Rob a bank using mines

And so forth and so on. Source is included in the zip, and I even put an .mp3 of the soundtrack in case someone finds it catchy.

Have fun!

entries.title: The Great Volcano Escape
entries.description:
'The Great Volcano Escape'

by @bluescrn, Made in under 48hrs for Ludum Dare #21

Sorry, there's no sound. (I'm currently looking for a free/cheap/lightweight
sound system that's suitable for little 2D PC projects...)

Please don't rate this game if your computer is too slow to run it! It should
run at 60fps on any reasonable gaming PC, but is unlikely to be playable on 
netbooks or laptops with weak GPUs. So I've included an LD48_LowSpec.exe that
just turns off the bloom and mist layers, which might help some people.


Controls:

Arrow keys - Lean forwards/back
Z          - Accelerate
X          - Brake (yes, you'll need this)
Space      - Restart level

Goal: Get to safetly without killing yourself... 


Levels

They're procedurally generated, but with fixed seeds. They get harder, and will become impossible
after a while...

The first 15 levels are definitely doable, after that... maybe not :)


Base Code Used:

The contents of code\base is my 'standard base code'. I've used it for
several Ludum Dare entries. It handles D3D/DInput setup, texture loading,
maths (vector/matrix), fonts, and drawing polygons. It also contains the
bloom effect.

Feel free to copy+paste any useful bits you might find in there...

All code in Code\LD48 and textures in \data were hacked together during the compo


Main Tools Used:

Visual Studio 2011, C++, DirectX9
Chipmunk (2D Physics engine)
Genetica (generating clouds + rock textures)
Photoshop CS5 (Drawing the bike+biker)

entries.title: The Hooks, the Lava and Me

Try to escape the advancing lava with your hooks and swing around obstacles in your way, as the wave gets faster and faster, until just a single mistake seals your fate as you are engulfed in the hot doom.

Think you got a good score? Submit it to the online highscores and compete with all the players!

In-Game Controls:
A/Left - Fire black hook
D/Right - Fire blue hook
The hooks are fired at your mouse cursor. They only stick to the black walls!
K - Suicide (improved version only)

entries.title: Zero Gravity Escape
entries.description:
Hi there. Far from my first LD but things did not go so smoothly. Had some other things to do these two days but still managed to sit some 20 hours behind computer.
Sadly only something like 10 were productive.

So, theme was too broad for my taste so I just started working on something I wanted to try for a while, to make a 2D Toribash like ragdoll toy. And I did. Had bunch of ideas how to make it in to an escape game afterwards. In the end went with zero gravity escape as with gravity its probably even more complex to control it then in Toribash lol :D

Used Flash and Box2D . No time and motivation left to do graphics and sounds so pure code only ;/ But it has its own charm, will work more on graphics later :) 

<Rant alert>
 So it was my worst LD ever ;( Firstly got stuck with some angle calculations(well usual stuff) but then... 
- Then my mouse broke ;( 
- Then second mouse broke in same way which made me wonder if it is my notebook?!?! 
- So I was finishing it in frustration with broken mouse and a touch pad. Considering that mouse is main input method here it was horrible. 
- So those 10 hours of trying to figure out what happened with mouse and trying to achieve at least something with touchpad were hours reserved for sounds, graphics and normal level went in to ;/
- Anyways it seems it is biggest LudumDare yet, so I was stuck trying to upload at 4Am until my own internet went down completely 0_o, just to add to problems and frustrations. So its actually good that submission was extended 12 hours because of site problems :)
</Rand alert>

So, some strong speech and frustration for me here, but ah well, at least played with things I wanted :D Hope when frustration will goes away will experiment with this more. It should be a fun template for various types of games. 

Update:
Added a video to YouTube with me passing this game http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YvdpZ4PiAO0 hope it will help people who never played Toribash to figure some things out, few advices:
- Use space to pause the game and issue many commands at once
- Remember about center of mass when you try to push
- Relaxed parts absorb shocks, stiff ones bounce, so its a good idea to be relaxed when you don't want to bounce, or stiff all parts when you want to push with maximal force
- And it is space, if you are flying in right direction just relax and wait, no need to go crazy and ruin your right direction :)

entries.title: Escape Cat
entries.description:
Escape Cat is a really simple typing test game, with a Nyan Cat lookalike for good measure. This being my first Ludum Dare, I wanted to do something excessively simple and arcadey. The game has 3 modes: Standard, where you simply type out a really silly story. The full text of what you have to type is displayed along the bottom. Along the top is your text entry box and the word you should type next. The second mode is called "Nyan mode" where you just type nyan over an over again until you become sick of it (or make 4 mistakes). The third mode is the one that most resembles an actual game, it's called Fish mode. Type the words that appear on the fish to destroy them, partly inspired by Typing of the Dead.

If you have kids, it might be something they could play. Or you could use it to brush up on your typing skills. Or, I dunno, use it as a screensaver.

entries.title: Geomancer Shepherd
entries.description:
**Windows binary has been fixed (hopefully)!**

Only includes a Windows binary, but Mac and Linux users should be able to download love2d (http://love2d.org/) and run the included source.

Being a geomancer is rewarding work, but sometimes demand for your services is slow. Between jobs, you work as the local shepherd. Being out in the pasture gives you plenty of opportunity to practice your wizardry however. In a freak subduction accident, you have unwittingly unleashed a hailstorm of fire! Use your powers to drive as many of the sheep as you can to their pen, gather some inexplicable stars for some reason, then escape to your portal!

Controls:
w: jump
a: left
d: right

mouse: magic target location
left click: pull ground
right click: push ground

As a geomancer, you have the power to manipulate earth. You power is stronger the closer you are to the target. The green circle shows you the strength at the current location. Careful, shaping the ground into odd arrangements may disturb the precarious balance of geomancy, leading to disappearing triangles, etc.! Shape the ground to guide sheep into the pen and reach stars. Position yourself and the ground to achieve this as quickly as possible. Be warned, fire spawns increasingly quickly, and touching it will cause you to restart the level. Complete the level by reaching the portal. There are two levels.

Scoring
per sheep in pen: 50 points
per star collected: 10 points
time: 0 (just pretend it matters, aim for a low time with as many points possible!)

entries.description:
Please note that this entry uses WebGL, which is not supported by IE. Works best with Chrome and Firefox.


You have been captured while trying to find the plans of the Nazi reich. In order to escape from Castle Puzzlestein you will have to use your brains instead of your brawns. Unlike the guards in the more well-known caste, the gauards here are quite slow. They will move only when you move. They will however try to catch you if they get a glimse of you.

Plan you actions ahead. At the far right of the screen is a palette with your available actions. Next to the palette is a container for your queue of actions. Either click these actions to add them to the queue or drag them in. The order of actions can also be rearranged. Remove actions by using the right mouse button.

When you are satisified with your selection, you may start playback of the queue by using the playback buttons at the bottom. This will play each action in the queue in sequence. If a guard catches you, the playback will stop.

Your ultimate goal is to reach the exit from each level. Good luck.

UPDATE:
I've added an updated version of the game, fixing some of the problems with the competition version. Please don't vote based on this version. These are some of the changes:

* Added minimap
* Grid on the floor
* Rotate avatar towards enemy on collision
* Change movement speed
* No more horizontal scrolling in sequence list
* Added an easier introduction level
* Added loading bar

entries.title: Globular Prisonbreak!
entries.description:
My game is called "Globular Prisonbreak". It's an action-puzzler about speed, precision, space, and color. A Blob creature, known as Bloopie, makes its escape from a Gnomish prison. There are 27 short levels in this frantic tetris-meets-frogger arcade.

The idea is to dodge globular bullets coming at you from all sides as you make your way to the top of the level. If you are hit, the glob attach to Bloopie, becoming an extension of its body. So just don't get hit right? Not so simple... Blocking your path are laser force field gates which must be disarmed by sacrificing an exposed glob of matching color from Bloopie's body. Don't have the right color handy? Just absorb it from the bullets. But here's where it gets fun--the glob bullets are initially all grey. An absorbed glob adopts the color of the floor tile where it was absorbed! Pay heed to next color you'll need... and get the bullet in the right spot! Stay thin or get stuck and crushed in the stone gateway exit.

What I used to make this game:
A netbook.
Flash Develop
Flex compiler
Flixel 2.55
A desktop with crash-a-lot hardware (for music/graphics).
Pxtone (ptVoice and ptCollage)

Now a few notes on my first experience with Ludum Dare:
I've been wanting to compete in ld48 or the jam for a few years now, but haven't had the time. I wasn't really prepared for this one either... I just stumbled here in the first several hours of competition and decided to join in. I'm so glad I did--it was a blast!

Unfortunately my first game could not be polished as well as I would have liked before presenting it. There are some bugs, although the whole thing is quite playable and enjoyable throughout. I never did beat it in development, although I have just now for the first time while writing this... so you can except it to get quite challenging. Some honest advice: The game will tend to hide its bugs if you don't mash keys. Keen sight and a little hesitance will escape through the final 10 levels.

I'm especially proud of the idea this game presents. I plan to improve on it in the future, starting with some fixes and features that didn't make the 7pm (PST) contest deadline.

And last but not least.. I'm VERY MUCH looking forward to trying out YOUR games over the next few weeks!

entries.title: Goat Milk
entries.description:
COMMENTS ARE BROKEN ON THIS PAGE (off and on).
If you can't leave a comment here, you can leave a comment on my blog at http://stozstudios.blogspot.com/2011/08/goat-milk.html.

Many weeks ago, the Dow Jones Industrial Average suddenly plunged by 500 points. Jerry the dairy farmer's retirement savings were destroyed, and he went into a profit-driven frenzy to recoup the loss. Searching for new sources of milk, Farmer Jerry turned to the nearest thing he could find: Barry the mountain goat.

You play as Barry. Your goal: don't get milked!

All this running from Farmer Jerry makes you tired, though, so you must make the occasional stop to eat grass, goatberries, and coffee beans, all while avoiding bottomless pits, mud holes, tumbling boulders, high winds, and burning hot magma.

Goat Milk features six action-packed levels of Goatberry-munching glory.


Music generated at http://www.earslap.com/projectslab/otomata
Sounds made by voice and sfxr.
Created with Game Maker. Graphics and animations created using Inkscape.

SETUP:
Windows only. The zipped folder contains a .exe file. Extract the .exe file into its own folder -- this is where it will store your saved progress. Double-click the .exe file to begin! Controls are explained on the menu screen.

entries.title: HMS Lance
entries.description:
XNA 4.0
Sound is quiet, please crank it up.
I built this game at 1440 by 900 and I think its crashing when run on a smaller resolution (any larger resolution should be fine).  I might try compressing all the game textures and source code to work at a much smaller resolution.  If anybody has any problems or has any suggestions please post in the comments!

Post Mortem:
I had something like 9 story screens and 1 game screen planed and after building the game and 4 screens I got so bored of drawing.  
Next time less art and more game.  
I was only able to commit 14 hours and I was still able to make an alright game, supper happy with my scoping not getting out of hand as I am usually really bad with that.  
I know the musket shot stuff doesn't really make sense, I should have taken it out and used more rocks and cannon balls.  
I was planning on doing a couple more but different little games and could have fit 1 more in if i had not done as much art.
The sound and the images don't sync up in the intro movie, I should have cut the audio into parts to match the images and then synked them individually.
1440 x 900 was a good resolution to work in, except people with smaller resolutions cant play the game.  Next time I'm going to look at how to build a game that can expand to full screen.

NextTime:
Less art.
Get a phsics engine before hand! (I rolled my own which took up about 2 hours of my time and leaves something to be desired with collision.)
Be smarter with the resolution.

entries.title: Saharan Scurry
entries.description:
Saharan Scurry
Created by Oliver "Tubbimora" Tun

Description
The Army are after you!
Escape from the Army by driving away in the conveniently placed jeep you found in the middle of the Saharan Desert!
Freedom is 10000m away!
But be careful, you'll have to drive through the emergency minefield placed by the Army and avoid the tanks chasing you!

Good luck!

Author's Notes
My first ever entry into Ludum Dare and one of my first ever completed games! Hooray! Entering this competition was a great experience to have and let me actually know what it was like working under a deadline. I had to cut a lot of ideas and fancy things from the final product in order to make it a functioning game, but I'm happy how it turned out even though there isn't much to it. I will most likely enter when the next LD comes around and hopefully be more experienced so I can create something more complex. Thanks to everyone who kept me going and Ludum Dare for an awesome 48 hours.

Tools Used
C# 2010 Express with XNA 4.0
Adobe Flash CS5
sfxr
SWFSheet
Paint.NET

entries.title: Beyond the Fourth Wall
entries.description:
It may have no sound whatsoever and be low on graphical detail, but it's high on weird!
...that's a good thing, right?
This is a very short point-and-click adventure game where you escape from a series of screens.

I expect the responses to this game to be... interesting.  I had to cut pretty much all the non-placeholder graphics, animation, and sound for time, as well as the last level (which I thought to be the cleverest- maybe I'll expand on this idea later), but hopefully I got the idea across well enough.  In place of all that stuff is a bizarre ending that I kinda had to think up on the spot.

I originally wanted a subtle, kinda artsy thing, but when I realized that I suck too much at art to do anything like that within the time constraints, I went in the complete opposite direction and abandoned all subtlety.  I tried to go for funny in a "what the hell did I just play" sort of way... though I didn't have the time to put much thought into that aspect.  Did I succeed at all?

Goal:
Outrun (escape) the disintegrating level behind you.

Jump, duck, and rotate gravity to get through the obstacles.

You'll gain speed the longer you run without hitting obstacles. Also note that crouching for longer than a moment will slow you down as well.

The green/grey rectangles at the bottom of the screen represent your speed.

Controls:
Mouse: look
Left click: jump
Right click: crouch
A: Rotate gravity left
D: Rotate gravity right
ESC: Exit

NOTE: You may need to install the Visual Studio 10 redist.

You play a hipster that must escape EchoMonica Park, and its denizens, before their loud, obnoxious and low quality music makes you puke. The faster you get out, the better your score. entries.title: Harvest
entries.description:
Plot:

You are the captain of an alien vessel that was transporting humans across the galaxy to be probed. The humans revolted and managed to explosively decompress themselves into space (wearing space suits). You were travelling so fast that they're spread out across several solar systems. Round up as many as you can. Don't let them escape.

How to play:

Click behind the ship to thrust it forward. You are pulled by the planets gravity. When all the humans in that system are collected, a portal to the next solar system will open. Fly into it to progress.

Goal:

Collect as many humans as possible. High scores game. High scores aren't saved to disk. You have 5 lives. Good Luck. 

Technical Details:

Written in Python (www.python.org). Requires Pyglet (http://code.google.com/p/pyglet/). Graphics were created in Pixelmator. Sounds were created in as3sfxr. The logo font is Pirulin by Typodermic. Free for commercial use.

It should run on Linux if you have python and pyglet installed, but I haven't had a chance to test it recently. Apologies if it doesn't work for you. Assets are included with the source distribution.

entries.description:
Lost World Lucy and the Temple of the Swine Lord!

It's an arcadey-shooter where you try to outrun the clock while bustin' caps into floating undead pig heads. As Lucy advances through the tomb's chambers, the pigs get harder, better, faster, stronger! And also just more numerous. Good luck, Lucy!

Totally intend to keep working on this in the future, so feel free to leave any suggestions down yonder! c:

The Windows link goes to the Ludum Dare build, with the source GM81 file included.

For future builds, go to http://www.hamstapowah.com/downloads/games/Temple.zip

entries.title: Qua-tzar
entries.description:
Qua-tzar is a simultaneous turn based multiplayer game. The object of the game is to get your BITs to your spaceship on the other side of the game board. Each player has three action points to use on movement during their turn. Once both players have input their commands both sets of commands happen simultaneously.

Do not look at the screen when your opponent is entering their commands. Try to predict where your opponent's pieces will move to block and capture them.

entries.title: Charge
entries.description:
XNA 4.0 was used to make this, so it's likely that you'll need Windows with XNA Framework 4.0 installed in order to play it!

You are a charged particle with a clear disregard for the laws of physics.
Hit SPACE to invert your polarity, causing different particles to attract/repel you.
Navigate using WSAD, but use sparingly - it drains your charge.
Regain your charge by touching oppositely-charged particles.
Escape the electromagnetic foam!

www.audiotool.com was used to make the music!
