entries.title: Escape from Monster City
entries.description:
Game home page: http://code.kevinworkman.com/EscapeFromMonsterCity/index.html

Jar: http://code.kevinworkman.com/EscapeFromMonsterCity/EscapeFromMonsterCity.jar

Java Web Start: http://code.kevinworkman.com/EscapeFromMonsterCity/EscapeFromMonsterCityWebStart.jnlp

Armed only with your flashlight, escape from a city infested with sleeping monsters! Don't get too close to the monsters, or they will wake up and eat you. Do you slowly sneak past the beasts, carefully looking around every corner, or do you run through the narrow alleys and risk the chance of running into a nest of monsters?

entries.title: Escape from the Wolf Castle
entries.description:
My game is about a rabbit trapped in a sort of castle full of wolves. I originally planned it to be more complex, with having the wolves chase you around, finding other rabbits and some other things. If it weren't for the 12-hour extension, this game would have a really small test room instead of a proper level and no sounds, so THANK YOU WEBSITE CRASH!

The game is sort of a dungeon crawler. It should really have more levels, but it was hard enough to make a single one and I don't have any more time. You run through a maze, find things blocking your path, and find things to unblock your path. The game's biggest feature is the turn-based fighting system I managed to put together, which I think is pretty cool for a 48-hour game. It's also pretty fun. I hope you enjoy playing it as much as I enjoyed making it!

EDIT: In response to the comments, the game did always feature a rabbit. I didn't really think about it, the only time it seemed weird was when I was making the bow-holding sprite, but even then it still seemed strangely natural.

entries.title: King Midas: Escape from the Deadly Block Dungeons
entries.description:
Well, it aint gonna win any prizes (most probably due to the meagre number of levels; I suck at level design!), but I'm not really bothered.
What matters to me is that I created a game in less than 48 hours, and for that I am very happy!

The basic premise of the game is that you, as King Midas, turns everything you touch to gold! (Well, just empty tiles actually. I'll claim that as artistic liberty.)
You get +10 points for each tile you convert, +100 for bonus tiles. The aim is to get through all the levels, converting as many tiles as you can to get the maximum points payoff!
Controls are simple, arrow keys for movement and Z to use your pickaxe (breaks a gold block in the direction you're looking, but costs you 200 gold!).

I hope you like it, and please do make levels if you want to. It's very simple, just go into res/level/ and make a 32x24 PNG for the level layout, and a txt file with the same name as the image for the description that appears at the top! Finally add your level name (filename without the extension) to list.txt in the order you would like it to appear and enjoy!
If you make any cool mods or whatever, do email them to me at [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, I'd love to hear from you :)

entries.title: Lost Psyche
entries.description:
WARNING: LOTS OF COLOURS AND FLASHING LIGHTS.

Let me take the time to invite you to escape reality for a while, sit back, be mesmerised, and allow you to guide the music along it's path to creation - with visuals intensifying to match. My experiment for this LD was Procedural Music.

To guide the music, you must avoid the red blobs, but attempt to collect the blue and green blobs. One will increase the chord complexity, and the other the progression complexity.

Controls are WASD to move, Esc will exit, and F1 will reset the game.

This is my second entry using my own engine, Psybrus. All engine code used is based on what was located at https://github.com/neilogd/Psybrus at the start of LD.

All game code is written in GameMonkey (http://www.somedude.net/gamemonkey/). See the .gm files in "Dist" for all the game code. For some idiotic reason I decided to lump everything very hackly into "game.gm". There you will find some horrific game code, along with the music generator. Hopefully I will get the time to clean this up, and improve upon it as there are so many avenues of music generation I wanted to explore, but didn't have the time to :(

entries.title: Luis the Thingemebober
entries.description:
I don't really like how it turned out. Theres tons of stuff I'd like to add, but I have no more time left. Like bosses and better graphics and better everything and more weapons, you get the point. Yes, I realise its a bloody mess of objects. The names went from 'objBox' to 'lolman' in a few hours.

The game is pretty easy, I should hope.

Anyway, I had tons of fun making this game. I'll be sure to participate next LD, hopefully with a C# or Java game. :P

Controls:
 Left/Right - Move
 Up - Jump
 Spacebar - Place bomb
 CHEATS ON - J
 CHEATS OFF - K


Over and out, Naarkie.

entries.title: SUBJECT:7
entries.description:
I'm stuck, HALP!: http://dl.dropbox.com/u/1287557/LD48/LD21/HINTS.txt

Plot:

You are SUBJECT:7.  You don't know much about yourself.  What you do know, is that you've been in captivity for as long as you can remember.  You're being held against your will, and you're referred to as SUBJECT:7 by your captors.

How to play:

Move with the arrow keys.  Other keys can be useful if stated in game.

Goal:

Find your way out.  This means sneaking past guards, decieving guards, and taking the hard route out.  Good luck.

Technical Details:

Written in C.  Uses SDL, OpenGL and OpenAL.  Graphics are made with GIMP.  Sound effects are made with SFXR.  The drumloops are made with Drumcircle (http://msm.runhello.com/?p=396).


Written and best tested under Linux.  The Windows-version is known to work very well in wine.

Hoping to get a Mac-version built soon.

entries.title: This is your dream
entries.description:
System requirements: Java, mouse

Made by Sara Kapli

Created using Processing, Photoshop,
Inkscape and Audacity

--------------------------------------
Escape. Most people have had dreams, 
or nightmares, where one is being
chased, usually by someone who has
no name nor face. In my dreams, I
also cannot get anywhere, my feet
just aren't moving regardless of how
I try. It's like I'm in quicksand, 
the more I try, the more I cannot move. 
I cannot even breath. The only way to 
get out of the suffocating horror is 
by waking up. And if I do wake up in
the middle of the night, chase will 
continue if I manage to get sleep again.
After this nightmare my head is heavy 
and my thoughts are cloudy the whole day. 
When it comes next evening, I go to sleep
and nightmare will start all over again.
There is no escape.
